original: gnyis kyis ni ba dan gyi tshul du mi'i pags pa 'dzin la /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni ba dan gyi tshul du mi'i pags pa 'dzin la /
translated: Two hold human skin like a banner.🔽Two make the vajra gesture in the manner of conferring initiation.

original: gnyis kyis ni dbang bskur ba'i tshul gyis rdo rje'i phyag rgya 'dzin la yang g-yas kyis ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba gsor /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni dbang bskur ba'i tshul gyis rdo rje'i phyag rgya 'dzin la yang g-yas kyis ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba gsor /
translated: The right hand holds a blazing five-pronged vajra,

original: g-yon gyis ni rdo rje kha tv'am ga 'dzin /
analyzed: g-yon gyis ni rdo rje kha tv'am ga 'dzin /
translated: and the left hand holds a vajra khaṭvāṅga.

original: yang g-yas kyis ma h'a raktas bkang ba'i kham pher 'dzin /
analyzed: yang g-yas kyis ma h'a raktas bkang ba'i kham pher 'dzin /
translated: Again, the right hand holds a skull-cup filled with mahārakta,

original: yang g-yon gyis ni ma h'a mam sas bkang ba'i ka p'a la 'dzin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang g-yon gyis ni ma h'a mam sas bkang ba'i ka p'a la 'dzin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: and the left hand holds a skull-cup filled with mahāmāṃsa.

original: gzhan dag na re phyag bzhi pa la gnyis ni mi'i pags pa'i gos 'dzin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyag bzhi pa la gnyis ni mi'i pags pa'i gos 'dzin la /
translated: Others say that the four-armed one holds human skin with two hands,

original: gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: and the other two hands are as before.

original: rdo rje kha tv'am zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gsum pas mtshan pa'i kha tv'am de la dril bu btags la /
analyzed: rdo rje kha tv'am zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gsum pas mtshan pa'i kha tv'am de la dril bu btags la /
translated: A vajra khaṭvāṅga is a khaṭvāṅga marked with three vajras, to which a bell is attached.

original: de'i sgra sil sil 'khrol ba ni rdo rje kha tv'am ga rdo rje dang bcas pa la dril bu 'khrol bar sgra dang ldan pa'o zhes pa gnyis pa'o mtshams sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgra sil sil 'khrol ba ni rdo rje kha tv'am ga rdo rje dang bcas pa la dril bu 'khrol bar sgra dang ldan pa'o zhes pa gnyis pa'o mtshams sbyar ba'o //
translated: The sound of its tinkling is the sound of the bell with the vajra, which is rung on the vajra khaṭvāṅga.🔽The two are connected.

original: de dag dang ldan pas na rdo rje kha tv'am ga dang rdo rjer bcas pa'i dril bu 'khrol ba'i sgrar bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pas na rdo rje kha tv'am ga dang rdo rjer bcas pa'i dril bu 'khrol ba'i sgrar bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of possessing those, it is called “the sound of the bell with the vajra and the vajra khaṭvāṅga.”

original: phyag rgya sna tshogs rnam 'phrul ba //
analyzed: phyag rgya sna tshogs rnam 'phrul ba //
translated: The dance of various mudrās

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i gar byed pa la rab tu 'jug pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i gar byed pa la rab tu 'jug pas so //
translated: means engaging in the dance of the great mudrā.

original: se ral kha'i tshul du dpung pa g-yon pa la kha tv'am ga yan lag la brten pa'i tshul dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya chen po de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: se ral kha'i tshul du dpung pa g-yon pa la kha tv'am ga yan lag la brten pa'i tshul dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya chen po de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that great mudrā, which is in the manner of an armlet on the left arm, supported on the limb of the khaṭvāṅga?

original: se ral kha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: se ral kha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text says “in the manner of an armlet,” and so on.

original: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: ma h'a raktas bkang ba'i ka p'a la 'dzin pa'i lag pas rdo rje kha tv'am ga la rgyab brten byas te /
analyzed: ma h'a raktas bkang ba'i ka p'a la 'dzin pa'i lag pas rdo rje kha tv'am ga la rgyab brten byas te /
translated: The hand that holds the kapāla filled with mahārakta supports the back of the vajra khaṭvāṅga.

original: g-yas pa ba dan gsum pas 'bar ba'i phreng ba can gyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ba dan gsum pas 'bar ba'i phreng ba can gyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: The right hand holds a five-pronged vajra with a garland of flames, with the three-banner mudra.

original: g-yas dang g-yon gyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: With the union of right and left,

original: zhes bya ba ni brla g-yon pa la rkang pa g-yas pa gzhag pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brla g-yon pa la rkang pa g-yas pa gzhag pas so //
translated: means with the right foot placed on the left thigh.

original: bde bar 'bab pa'i gar byed pas //
analyzed: bde bar 'bab pa'i gar byed pas //
translated: Dancing with the descent of bliss,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa 'dis 'dus pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa 'dis 'dus pas so //
translated: means with this posture, the union.

original: skyil mo krung ni phyed bcas la //
analyzed: skyil mo krung ni phyed bcas la //
translated: The half-lotus posture,

original: zhes bya ba ni rkang pa g-yon pa sa la gzhag pas so //🔽rkang pa rang gi brlas zhes bya ba ni brla g-yon par dang sbyar bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkang pa g-yon pa sa la gzhag pas so // rkang pa rang gi brlas zhes bya ba ni brla g-yon par dang sbyar bas so //
translated: means with the left foot placed on the ground.🔽The foot is placed on the thigh,🔽means with the right foot placed on the left thigh.🔽Binding,

original: bsdams nas zhes bya ba ni yang rkang pa g-yas pa g-yon pa'i steng du gzhag ste /
analyzed: bsdams nas zhes bya ba ni yang rkang pa g-yas pa g-yon pa'i steng du gzhag ste /
translated: means with the right foot placed on the left foot,

original: brla'i @94b bar du bcug nas btsir ba'o //
analyzed: brla'i @94b bar du bcug nas btsir ba'o //
translated: pressing the thighs together.🔽With that,

original: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni skyil mo krung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni skyil mo krung ngo //
translated: means with the half-lotus posture.

original: de nas bde bar brla bsdams nas //
analyzed: de nas bde bar brla bsdams nas //
translated: Then, with the thighs bound in bliss,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: de'i nang du gnas pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang pa g-yas pas rkang pa g-yon pa bde bar bsdams nas /
analyzed: de'i nang du gnas pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang pa g-yas pas rkang pa g-yon pa bde bar bsdams nas /
translated: In that, the object of practice, having well bound the right foot with the left foot,

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du phyir btags pa la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du phyir btags pa la sogs pa byed do //
translated: one should do the turning back, etc., as one wishes.

original: sgyu ma zhes pa ni dga' ba'i dor thabs so //
analyzed: sgyu ma zhes pa ni dga' ba'i dor thabs so //
translated: The illusion is the posture of passion.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni skyil mo krung gi phyag rgya'o //🔽de nas brla phrag bskyod pa yis //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni skyil mo krung gi phyag rgya'o // de nas brla phrag bskyod pa yis //
translated: The those is the mudra of the cross-legged posture.🔽 Then, by shaking the thighs,

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du bsgoms pa'i bud med kyi rkang pa g-yas pas brla g-yon pa bskyod cing bsgul bas ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du bsgoms pa'i bud med kyi rkang pa g-yas pas brla g-yon pa bskyod cing bsgul bas ;
translated: one should shake the left thigh with the right foot of the woman meditated upon in that.

original: dpal he ru ka'i 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i 'bab pa ste /
translated: The descent of Sri Heruka

original: de'i sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi mkha' 'gro gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi mkha' 'gro gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: is so called because of that practice, and because of the dakinis of the buddhas.

original: dkyil 'khor 'dir zhi ba'i gdong can ni dkar mo'o //🔽rmongs pa'i gdong can ni rab rmongs ma'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dir zhi ba'i gdong can ni dkar mo'o // rmongs pa'i gdong can ni rab rmongs ma'o //
translated: In this mandala, the one with a peaceful face is the white one.🔽 The one with a deluded face is the one with great delusion.

original: shin tu dga' ba'i gdong can ni sbos byed ma'o //
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba'i gdong can ni sbos byed ma'o //
translated: The one with a very passionate face is the one who is passionate.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i gdong can ni gtum mo'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i gdong can ni gtum mo'o //
translated: The face of the one who is transformed is Caṇḍālī.

original: shi ba ldang ba'i tshul gyis gdong can ni sme sha can te /
analyzed: shi ba ldang ba'i tshul gyis gdong can ni sme sha can te /
translated: The face of the one who has the manner of rising from death is Pukkasa.

original: las rnams kyang zhi ba dang / drag po dang / rmongs pa dang / 'chi ba slong ba dang / 'chi ba ldang ba dang / lta ba rnams ni rim bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las rnams kyang zhi ba dang / drag po dang / rmongs pa dang / 'chi ba slong ba dang / 'chi ba ldang ba dang / lta ba rnams ni rim bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: The rites are to be known as pacifying, violent, stupefying, raising the dead, reviving the dead, and the views.

original: de bzhin du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / chang dang chu dang / lcug ma dang / ras dang / me mar rnams kyang bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de la re res sbyin na des rgyas 'debs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / chang dang chu dang / lcug ma dang / ras dang / me mar rnams kyang bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de la re res sbyin na des rgyas 'debs so //
translated: Similarly, flowers, incense, liquor, water, twigs, cloth, and lamps are also seals, since each is given to the one who is to be accomplished, and by that, the seal is impressed.

original: rtse gcig mnyam par sbyor ba yis //🔽zhes bya ba ni dkar mo'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyis kyang phyag rgyas 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig mnyam par sbyor ba yis // zhes bya ba ni dkar mo'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyis kyang phyag rgyas 'debs pa'o //
translated: With one-pointed equipoise,🔽the seal is impressed by the meditative stabilization endowed with the practice of Gaurī.

original: gnyer ba'i tshul ni rku byed ma'i sbyor ba dang bcas pas snying 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: gnyer ba'i tshul ni rku byed ma'i sbyor ba dang bcas pas snying 'dren pa'o //
translated: The manner of the one who is to be sought is the drawing of the heart with the practice of the one who steals.

original: bde ba sbyin pa'i tshul gyis ni rab myos ma'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas rmongs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba sbyin pa'i tshul gyis ni rab myos ma'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas rmongs par byed pa'o //
translated: By the method of giving bliss, one causes confusion through the application of the intoxicated one.

original: ro langs ma'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ni shi ba la chus mngon par 'thor zhing slong ba'o //
analyzed: ro langs ma'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ni shi ba la chus mngon par 'thor zhing slong ba'o //
translated: By the application of the zombie, one revives the dead through sprinkling with water.

original: se go la brdab pa dang ldan pa na sbos byed ma'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ni gar byed pa'o //
analyzed: se go la brdab pa dang ldan pa na sbos byed ma'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ni gar byed pa'o //
translated: By the application of the one who causes fear, one dances through the application of the one who causes fear.

original: dal bus gyen du rab 'byin pas gtum mo sbyor ba dang ldan pas gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dal bus gyen du rab 'byin pas gtum mo sbyor ba dang ldan pas gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: By the application of the fierce one, one kills through slowly exhaling.

original: dbugs 'byin pa'i tshul gyis sme sha ma'i rnal 'byor gyis za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa'i tshul gyis sme sha ma'i rnal 'byor gyis za bar byed pa'o //
translated: By the yoga of the one who devours, one eats through the method of exhaling.

original: gzhan yang @95a * //🔽g-yon du lta bas blta zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang @95a * // g-yon du lta bas blta zhing /
translated: Moreover,

original: dkar mo'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas rgyas 'debs so //
analyzed: dkar mo'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas rgyas 'debs so //
translated: one seals with the application of the white one by looking to the left.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i snying gar blo bcug la yi ge ho zhes pa dang lag pas drang ba'i rku byed ma'i sbyor bas snying 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i snying gar blo bcug la yi ge ho zhes pa dang lag pas drang ba'i rku byed ma'i sbyor bas snying 'byin pa'o //
translated: One extracts the heart of the one to be accomplished by placing the mind at the heart of the one to be accomplished, saying the syllable hoḥ, and stealing with the hand through the application of the one who steals.

original: mngon du za ba'am bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: mngon du za ba'am bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: One should eat or accomplish.

original: byed pa ni rab rmongs ma'i sbyor bas rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa ni rab rmongs ma'i sbyor bas rmongs par byed do //
translated: The “doer” is the one who, by the practice of the “greatly deluded,” deludes.

original: mngon du yid kyis 'khyud pa'i ro langs ma'i sbyor bas 'chi ba slong bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon du yid kyis 'khyud pa'i ro langs ma'i sbyor bas 'chi ba slong bar byed do //
translated: The “manifest” is the one who, by the practice of the “zombie,” revives the dead.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang gnyis su med par gyur nas gar byed pa'i spos byed ma'i sbyor bas gsod par byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang gnyis su med par gyur nas gar byed pa'i spos byed ma'i sbyor bas gsod par byed do //
translated: The “accomplished” is the one who, by the practice of the “incense,” kills by becoming nondual with the object of practice and dancing.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang gcig tu gyur pa bde ba'i rab tu rmongs pas rnam par myos pa'i gtum pa'i sbyor bas brgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang gcig tu gyur pa bde ba'i rab tu rmongs pas rnam par myos pa'i gtum pa'i sbyor bas brgyal bar byed do //
translated: The “accomplished” is the one who, by the practice of the “fierce one,” causes to faint by becoming one with the object of practice and by the great delusion of bliss.

original: za ba'i tshul can sme sha ma'i sbyor bas za bar byed do //
analyzed: za ba'i tshul can sme sha ma'i sbyor bas za bar byed do //
translated: The “one who has the mode of eating” is the one who, by the practice of the “butcher,” eats.

original: mda' bzhi btsugs pa'i tshul gyis tshangs pa gdong bzhi pa'i mgo bo ltung bar byed pa'i rgyas 'debs so //
analyzed: mda' bzhi btsugs pa'i tshul gyis tshangs pa gdong bzhi pa'i mgo bo ltung bar byed pa'i rgyas 'debs so //
translated: The “one who has the mode of planting four arrows” is the one who, by the practice of the “seal,” causes the head of the four-faced Brahmā to fall.

original: 'jig rten gsum las brgal ba'i tshul can rku byed ma'i sbyor bas lcags kyus 'dren cing snying 'byin to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las brgal ba'i tshul can rku byed ma'i sbyor bas lcags kyus 'dren cing snying 'byin to //
translated: The “one who has the mode of transcending the three worlds” is the one who, by the practice of the “thief,” draws with a hook and plucks out the heart.

original: sa la 'dren pa'i tshul can rab rmongs ma'i sbyor bas rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: sa la 'dren pa'i tshul can rab rmongs ma'i sbyor bas rmongs par byed do //
translated: The method of leading to the earth is the practice of the very confused, which is to confuse.

original: bdud rtsi'i bum pas dbang bskur ba'i tshul can ni ro langs ma'i'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i bum pas dbang bskur ba'i tshul can ni ro langs ma'i'o //
translated: The method of conferring empowerment with the vase of nectar is that of the zombie.

original: rang gi phyag rgya'i tshul bstan pa ni ro langs ma'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya'i tshul bstan pa ni ro langs ma'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The method of displaying one's own seal is the practice of the zombie.

original: de dang ldan pas 'chi ba slong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas 'chi ba slong bar byed do //
translated: Endowed with that, one revives the dead.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig gnyis su med par gyur pas dur khrod du mchog tu sbyor ba thams cad las mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang gis rdzogs par gyur par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig gnyis su med par gyur pas dur khrod du mchog tu sbyor ba thams cad las mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang gis rdzogs par gyur par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Having become nondual with the one to be accomplished, one should view the supreme union in the charnel ground as being perfected by the power of all that is desired.

original: bdun pa las kyi phyag rgya yin //
analyzed: bdun pa las kyi phyag rgya yin //
translated: The seventh is the karmamudra.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid ni las kyi don gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid ni las kyi don gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Those are the karmamudra of the meaning seal.

original: mdog ni dkar ba dang / dmar ba dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / sngon po dang / nag po'o //
analyzed: mdog ni dkar ba dang / dmar ba dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / sngon po dang / nag po'o //
translated: The colors are white, red, black, white, green, blue, and black.

original: phyag rgya'i lan zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis legs par rgyas 'debs pa de'i don du mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba bya ba gang yin pa de ni phyag rgya'i lan te /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i lan zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis legs par rgyas 'debs pa de'i don du mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba bya ba gang yin pa de ni phyag rgya'i lan te /
translated: The response to a seal is that which is employed for the purpose of not being deceived by the good seal-impression of others.

original: dpal ldan g-yon dkur brten pa la //
analyzed: dpal ldan g-yon dkur brten pa la //
translated: The seal is the left arm, which is glorious, and is placed on the hip.

original: dpal ldan lag pa g-yas pas padma'i khu tshur bcings la /
analyzed: dpal ldan lag pa g-yas pas padma'i khu tshur bcings la /
translated: The response to the seal is the right arm, which is glorious, and is made into a lotus fist.

original: mig rab tu bltas ba'i rdo rje padmo'i slong ba 'di dang / rdo rje glu dang gar dang ldan pa'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: mig rab tu bltas ba'i rdo rje padmo'i slong ba 'di dang / rdo rje glu dang gar dang ldan pa'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: This is the request of the vajra lotus, with the eyes wide open, and with the seal endowed with the vajra song and dance.

original: gang zhig 'joms par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig 'joms par byed ce na /
translated: What is it that is destroyed?

original: de nas zhes @95b pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes @95b pa ste /
translated: Then, means

original: he ru ka la sogs pa'i phyag rgya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: he ru ka la sogs pa'i phyag rgya zhes pa'o //
translated: the seals of Heruka and so forth.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje'i sbyor ba ni he ru ka'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje'i sbyor ba ni he ru ka'o //
translated: The glory is the vajra union, which is Heruka.🔽 The song is

original: de'i glu blang ba ni /
analyzed: de'i glu blang ba ni /
translated: that which is sung.

original: gang gis gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag rgya chen po bcings pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag rgya chen po bcings pa'o //
translated: The dance is that which is performed by one who is preceded by the dance, and who binds the great seal.🔽

original: gzigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'gyur ba'i phyag rgyas thob la zhes bya bas ni zhal drag po ston to ;🔽/'o byed 'khyud pas rmongs mdzad de //
analyzed: gzigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'gyur ba'i phyag rgyas thob la zhes bya bas ni zhal drag po ston to ; /'o byed 'khyud pas rmongs mdzad de //
translated: The line with the seal of various kinds of visions shows the wrathful face.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal gnyis pa rab tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal gnyis pa rab tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: The line deluded by kissing and embracing shows the second face, which is thoroughly deluded.

original: bde ba'i mchog ston kun gsol zhes bya ba ni zhal gsum pa za byed kyi rang bzhin no //🔽bde mchog ngo mtshar bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog ston kun gsol zhes bya ba ni zhal gsum pa za byed kyi rang bzhin no // bde mchog ngo mtshar bstan du gsol //
translated: The line showing the supreme bliss, all are invited shows the third face, which has the nature of devouring.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal bzhi pa sgeg pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal bzhi pa sgeg pa'o //
translated: The line show the supreme wonder shows the fourth face, which is playful.

original: rgyas btab ces bya ba la sogs pas ni zhal bzhi'i sgo nas rim pa bzhin du bskul ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas btab ces bya ba la sogs pas ni zhal bzhi'i sgo nas rim pa bzhin du bskul ba'o //
translated: The line sealed and so forth is an invocation through the four faces in sequence.

original: h'um aa la la la ho snang bar mdzod ces pa ni snang ba bskul ba'o //
analyzed: h'um aa la la la ho snang bar mdzod ces pa ni snang ba bskul ba'o //
translated: The line hum ah la la la ho, be manifest is an invocation of the light.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dkar mo la sogs pa'i glu bstan pa'i phyir dam tshig dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;

analyzed: kye grogs po rnams zhes pa'o //

analyzed: rgyal po sgyu ma mchog gi glu //
translated: The song of the supreme illusion king

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje nyi ma 'byung ba'i glu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje nyi ma 'byung ba'i glu ste /
translated: is the song of the arising of Vajrasūrya.

original: gang gis gar sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gar sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa'o //
translated: By whom the great seal is bound, preceded by dance.

original: khams gsum ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The three realms are the three worlds.

original: kun gyi rgyal srid ni der dbang bskur ba'i sprul pa ste /
analyzed: kun gyi rgyal srid ni der dbang bskur ba'i sprul pa ste /
translated: The kingdom of all is the emanation consecrated there.

original: des na gdul bya rnams kyi ser sna spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gdul bya rnams kyi ser sna spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon the stinginess of those to be tamed,

original: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa ni mchog gi nor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa ni mchog gi nor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the consecration, etc. are endowed with supreme wealth.

original: 'di ni dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
translated: This is the urging through consecration.

original: 'jal dum g-yul 'gyed rnam mang khyad par sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bzhes bya ba ni sdums dang 'dul ba dang chad pa phul du byung bas so //
analyzed: 'jal dum g-yul 'gyed rnam mang khyad par sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bzhes bya ba ni sdums dang 'dul ba dang chad pa phul du byung bas so //
translated: The various kinds of peace-making, war-making, and punishment are the Buddha's discipline.

original: de nas g-yul 'gyed pas rgyal ba ni /
analyzed: de nas g-yul 'gyed pas rgyal ba ni /
translated: Then, the victory in war is

original: ser sna rab tu spong bar mdzad nas sems can phun sum @97b tshogs pa rnam pa mang po thob par mdzad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ser sna rab tu spong bar mdzad nas sems can phun sum @97b tshogs pa rnam pa mang po thob par mdzad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: the abandonment of stinginess and the attainment of the various kinds of abundance for sentient beings.

original: de ni rgyal po bde mchog sgyur ma ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyal po bde mchog sgyur ma ste /
translated: That is the king, the supreme bliss-maker.

original: gter gyi sgo nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: gter gyi sgo nas bskul ba'o //
translated: This is the urging through the door of the treasure.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs 'jal dum rnam par rgyal ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la yod pa'i ser sna rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs 'jal dum rnam par rgyal ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la yod pa'i ser sna rnams spong ba'o //
translated: The various kinds of peace-making and war-making are the abandonment of the stinginess that exists in the mind-streams of sentient beings.

original: de'i don du rgyal mtshan te rgyal mtshan mchog gi sprul pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don du rgyal mtshan te rgyal mtshan mchog gi sprul pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: For that purpose, the victory banner is the supreme victory banner, and he who has it is so called.

original: 'di ni rgyal mtshan mchog gi sgo nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal mtshan mchog gi sgo nas bskul ba'o //
translated: This is the urging through the door of the supreme victory banner.

original: rgyal po ni rdo rje nyi ma ste /
analyzed: rgyal po ni rdo rje nyi ma ste /
translated: The king is Vajrasūrya.

original: de yi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa bde ba'i mchog ni bde ba'i dam pa'o //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa bde ba'i mchog ni bde ba'i dam pa'o //
translated: The supreme bliss that is of its very essence is the highest bliss.

original: de thob pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi mchod pa chen po sprul pa'i sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi mchod pa chen po sprul pa'i sgyu ma'o //
translated: In order to attain that, the great worship of sentient beings is the emanation of illusion.

original: de nyid ni tshul ldan te tshul zhes pa ni sprul pa bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni tshul ldan te tshul zhes pa ni sprul pa bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: That very [worship] is the way, and the way is to be seen as like an emanation.

original: 'di yang mchod pa chen po'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang mchod pa chen po'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
translated: This also is an exhortation by way of the great worship.

original: gzhan yang sems can sprin la byang chub ces bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can sprin la byang chub ces bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Moreover, the cloud of sentient beings is called enlightenment by way of the consecration.

original: mchod sbyin sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gter gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: mchod sbyin sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gter gyi sgo nas so //
translated: The various offerings, etc. are by way of the treasure.

original: bdag gi re ba kun sgrubs myur du ston //
analyzed: bdag gi re ba kun sgrubs myur du ston //
translated: Fulfill all my wishes, quickly show!

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan mchog gi sgo nas so //🔽aa la la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan mchog gi sgo nas so // aa la la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni //
translated: is by way of the supreme victory banner.

original: mchod pa chen po'i sgo nas lha mo rnams kyi glu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po'i sgo nas lha mo rnams kyi glu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The goddesses' songs are to be taught by way of the great worship with A la la, etc.

original: mi zad gter gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi zad gter gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The inexhaustible treasure, etc. is stated in order to teach that.

original: mi zang gter gyi dbang bskur ba'i //🔽zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: mi zang gter gyi dbang bskur ba'i // zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The bestowal of the inexhaustible treasure.

original: mi zad pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba dang / rgyal mtshan dang mchod pa ste /
analyzed: mi zad pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba dang / rgyal mtshan dang mchod pa ste /
translated: The inexhaustible, the bestowal, the victory, the banner, and the worship.

original: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du khyad par 'di dag thams cad kyang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du khyad par 'di dag thams cad kyang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The word “all” refers to all of these distinctions, which are the emanations of the bestowal, etc.

original: de dag thams cad kyang bud med rin po che rnams kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang bud med rin po che rnams kyi phyir te /
translated: And all of these are for the sake of the jewel of the woman.

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i don du rnam par dag pa'i bud med thob pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i don du rnam par dag pa'i bud med thob pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The cause of attaining the pure woman is for the sake of the bestowal, etc. of sentient beings.

original: rin chen sna tshogs kun nang na //
analyzed: rin chen sna tshogs kun nang na //
translated: Among all the various jewels,

original: bud med rin chen gcig pu mchog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: bud med rin chen gcig pu mchog / ces pa ste /
translated: the jewel of the woman is the one supreme.

original: rin po che bsags pa thams cad kyi nang na bud med rin po che gcig pu ni mchog ste /
analyzed: rin po che bsags pa thams cad kyi nang na bud med rin po che gcig pu ni mchog ste /
translated: Among all the various jewels, the jewel of the woman is the one supreme,

original: dam par gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dam par gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: the one that has become the best.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: bud med rin chen dag pa dam pa ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pas na bud med rin po che gang yin pa de ni dbang bskur ba la @98a * //
analyzed: bud med rin chen dag pa dam pa ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pas na bud med rin po che gang yin pa de ni dbang bskur ba la @98a * //
translated: The pure, excellent jewel woman is the nature of the consecration and so forth, and is free from all faults.

original: sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang bsgom pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang bsgom pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever the jewel woman is, that is the root of all consecration and so forth, and of meditative stabilization, cultivation, and so forth.

original: de bas na de las thob pa ni rgyal srid thams cad mnyam sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de las thob pa ni rgyal srid thams cad mnyam sbyor ba ste /
translated: Thus, the attainment from that is the union of all royal powers,

original: rdo rje nyi ma'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the union of the vajra sun.

original: dpal rta mchog gi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dpal rta mchog gi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the union of glorious Hayagriva,

original: rnal 'byor de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽thams cad dag par mos pa yis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / thams cad dag par mos pa yis //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the reality yoga, and so on.🔽With the intention of generating the enthusiasm of sentient beings

original: zhes bya ba ni le lo spang ba sngon du byas pas sems can rnams brtson 'grubs bskyed par dgongs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni le lo spang ba sngon du byas pas sems can rnams brtson 'grubs bskyed par dgongs pas so //
translated: through the prior abandonment of laziness,🔽[the Bhagavān] declares, “with the intention of purifying everything.”

original: 'jig rten thams cad ces bya ba ni dbang phyug dam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ces bya ba ni dbang phyug dam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All worlds” are the highest lord, and so on.

original: rab tu 'joms zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'joms zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Subjugates” means

original: gnon pa ste phyag gi rnam pa gyen du 'byung ba'i cha byed brag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnon pa ste phyag gi rnam pa gyen du 'byung ba'i cha byed brag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mudra of pressing is the gesture of pressing down.

original: phyag bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni so sor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni so sor bstan pa ste /
translated: The four-armed one is taught separately.

original: g-yon na khu tshur gyis sna tshogs padma bsnams /
analyzed: g-yon na khu tshur gyis sna tshogs padma bsnams /
translated: In the left [hands] he holds a multicolored lotus with a fist.

original: g-yas pa ba dan gsum pa bsgreng ba'i tshul gyis sna tshogs rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ba dan gsum pa bsgreng ba'i tshul gyis sna tshogs rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the right [hands] he holds a multicolored vajra in the manner of holding aloft a three-bannered [vajra].

original: phyag gnyis na ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan las ci dga' bar bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis na ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan las ci dga' bar bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the two [remaining] hands he holds whatever implements of Vajrasattva and so forth are pleasing.

original: gzhan dag na re phyag ni rnam pa bzhi bzhi zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyag ni rnam pa bzhi bzhi zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that the hands are four by four.

original: rgyud gzhan dang rjes su mthun pa ste /🔽g-yas kyi bzhi la ba dan gsum pa bsgreng ba'i tshul can dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bsnams pa dang / ral gri dang mnga' bsnams pa ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang rjes su mthun pa ste / g-yas kyi bzhi la ba dan gsum pa bsgreng ba'i tshul can dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bsnams pa dang / ral gri dang mnga' bsnams pa ste bzhi'o //
translated: This is in accordance with other tantras.🔽In the four right [hands] he holds a three-bannered [vajra] in the manner of holding aloft, a multicolored vajra, a sword, and a goad.

original: g-yon gyi khu tshur gyis sna tshogs padma 'dzin pa dang / mdung dang / dbyig pa dang / gzhu bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: g-yon gyi khu tshur gyis sna tshogs padma 'dzin pa dang / mdung dang / dbyig pa dang / gzhu bsnams pa ste /
translated: In the four left [hands] he holds a multicolored lotus with a fist, a spear, a club, and a bow.

original: phyag brgyad pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyag brgyad pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: He has eight arms.

original: zhabs bzhi pa zhes bya ba g-yas brkyang ba dang / g-yas kyis gsum grub ma dang dpal mo gnon pa g-yon gyis mig gsum pa dang / khyab 'jug gnon pa /
analyzed: zhabs bzhi pa zhes bya ba g-yas brkyang ba dang / g-yas kyis gsum grub ma dang dpal mo gnon pa g-yon gyis mig gsum pa dang / khyab 'jug gnon pa /
translated: He has four feet, the right extended and the left contracted, trampling on Sumbha and Śrīdevī, and on Trilocana and Viṣṇu.

original: yang g-yas g-yon gnyis kyis grol ma dang / dga' ba dang / tshangs pa dang / lha'i dbang phyug rim bzhin gnon pas bzhugs nas snga ma bzhin du gar sngon du 'gro bas phyag rgya chen po bcing ba'o //
analyzed: yang g-yas g-yon gnyis kyis grol ma dang / dga' ba dang / tshangs pa dang / lha'i dbang phyug rim bzhin gnon pas bzhugs nas snga ma bzhin du gar sngon du 'gro bas phyag rgya chen po bcing ba'o //
translated: Again, with the two right and left hands he tramples on Mukunda, Nandin, Brahmā, and Śiva, respectively.

original: glu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: glu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the song,

original: myos byed stong pas lhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: myos byed stong pas lhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “With a bliss that exceeds the thousandfold intoxication,” and so on.

original: myos byed ni 'dod pa'i lha ste /
analyzed: myos byed ni 'dod pa'i lha ste /
translated: The intoxication is the god of love.

original: de stong pas lhag pa'i bde bas 'dod pa'i gzugs ston pa ste /
analyzed: de stong pas lhag pa'i bde bas 'dod pa'i gzugs ston pa ste /
translated: With a bliss that exceeds the thousandfold intoxication, he displays the form of a god.

original: yid 'phrog pa'i skur sprul pa mdzad pas po //
analyzed: yid 'phrog pa'i skur sprul pa mdzad pas po //
translated: He emanates a form that captivates the mind.

original: 'dis ni zhal dang po sgeg par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhal dang po sgeg par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the first face to be charming.

original: @98b gdul ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas na /
analyzed: @98b gdul ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas na /
translated: “In accordance with the power of those to be tamed,” and so on.

original: zhal drag po bstan to //
analyzed: zhal drag po bstan to //
translated: He displays a wrathful face.

original: gzhan yang zhi ba'i skur yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa zhi ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhi ba'i skur yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa zhi ba ste /
translated: Moreover, with “also a peaceful body” and so forth, the third is peaceful,

original: tshangs pa'i zhal lo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i zhal lo //
translated: the face of Brahmā.

original: thams cad dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzhi ba rta gdong ngo //🔽hi hi hi hi zhes bya ba ni pha rol gnon pas rab tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzhi ba rta gdong ngo // hi hi hi hi zhes bya ba ni pha rol gnon pas rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: With “all pure” and so forth, the fourth is the horse face.🔽“Hi hi hi hi” is the total destruction of the enemy.

original: hu lu hu lu zhes bya ba ni zhugs shigs pa'o //
analyzed: hu lu hu lu zhes bya ba ni zhugs shigs pa'o //
translated: “Hu lu hu lu” is the destruction of the one who is bound.

original: ru ta ma ta zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ru ta ma ta zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Ru ta ma ta” is the one who is free from joy.

original: sma ra ra ti ni mngon par dran pa ste /
analyzed: sma ra ra ti ni mngon par dran pa ste /
translated: “Sma ra ra ti” is the one who is mindful.

original: zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa mngon sum du mdzod cig pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i nyams dang ldan pa mngon sum du mdzod cig pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “Be present” is endowed with the experience of peace.

original: aa la la la la ho zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //🔽sumbha zhes bya ba ni ltung bar mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: aa la la la la ho zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o // sumbha zhes bya ba ni ltung bar mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: “A la la la la ho” is the one who is amazed.🔽“Sum bha” is the one who should fall.

original: ni sumbha ni zhes bya ba ni brgyal bar ro //
analyzed: ni sumbha ni zhes bya ba ni brgyal bar ro //
translated: “Ni sum bha ni” is the one who should faint.

original: h'um zhes bya ba ni gsod pas so //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba ni gsod pas so //
translated: “Hum” is the one who should kill.

original: phat phat zhes bya ba ni gdul ba ste /
analyzed: phat phat zhes bya ba ni gdul ba ste /
translated: “Phaṭ phaṭ” is the one who should be tamed.

original: de dag ni bskul ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni bskul ba'i tshig go //
translated: These are the words of exhortation.

original: lha mo rnams kyi glu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyi glu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the songs of the goddesses,

original: mdza' bo mi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdza' bo mi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The friend, the human,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar bya ba 'am mi bya ba yongs su rtog pa'i dga' ba gang yin pa'i mir skye ba ni mdza' ba de yang bcos ma ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba 'am mi bya ba yongs su rtog pa'i dga' ba gang yin pa'i mir skye ba ni mdza' ba de yang bcos ma ste /
translated: The human who is born in this way, who is delighted by the consideration of what to do and what not to do, is a friend who is artificial.

original: de la mdza' bo yin zhes mdza' bar su zhig smra /
analyzed: de la mdza' bo yin zhes mdza' bar su zhig smra /
translated: Who would say of him, “He is a friend”?

original: yang rgol bar brtsam pa gang du bya ba'am mi bya zhes yongs su rtog pa skyes pa de yang rgol ba bcos ma ste /
analyzed: yang rgol bar brtsam pa gang du bya ba'am mi bya zhes yongs su rtog pa skyes pa de yang rgol ba bcos ma ste /
translated: Moreover, the one who begins to dispute, who is born with the consideration of what to do and what not to do, is a disputant who is artificial.

original: de la dpa' ba yin zhes su zhig zer bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la dpa' ba yin zhes su zhig zer bar 'gyur /
translated: Who would say of him, “He is a hero”?

original: sna tshogs padma la sogs pa lha mo gnyis ni glu 'di nyid las rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes la la zer ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma la sogs pa lha mo gnyis ni glu 'di nyid las rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes la la zer ro //
translated: Some say that the two goddesses, Viśvamātā and so on, are inferred from this very song.

original: dkyil 'khor du lha rnams kyi dam tshig gis bzhugs par bya ba dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang bdag nyid kyis bsgrubs pas rang gi dam tshig rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du lha rnams kyi dam tshig gis bzhugs par bya ba dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang bdag nyid kyis bsgrubs pas rang gi dam tshig rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the pledges of the deities who abide by their pledges in the mandala, and in order to demonstrate the pledge seals blessed by the pledges of the yogins themselves who have accomplished them,

original: mdzub mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdzub mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the index fingers, etc.

original: mdzub mos mthe bong mnan nas ni /
analyzed: mdzub mos mthe bong mnan nas ni /
translated: The index fingers pressing the thumbs

original: zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar ba byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar ba byas la /
translated: means that one should join the palms,

original: mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /🔽de'i rtse mo rang gi mthe bo'i rtse mos mnan pa'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste / de'i rtse mo rang gi mthe bo'i rtse mos mnan pa'o //
translated: bend the two index fingers,🔽and press the tips of those with the tips of the thumbs.

original: rang gi mthe bos mdzub mo mnan //
analyzed: rang gi mthe bos mdzub mo mnan //
translated: The thumbs pressing the index fingers

original: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo de dag nyid dang mthe'o sbyar nas rim gyis bzhugs pa ni dpal grub spyan no //🔽rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba bcings la rim pa de nyid kyis rdo rje spyan gnyis byas te /🔽rdo rje spyan @99a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo de dag nyid dang mthe'o sbyar nas rim gyis bzhugs pa ni dpal grub spyan no // rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba bcings la rim pa de nyid kyis rdo rje spyan gnyis byas te / rdo rje spyan @99a * //
translated: means that one should join the index fingers and thumbs, and the remaining fingers should be gradually extended, which is the glorious Locanā.🔽Having formed the vajra-folded-palms gesture, one should make the two vajra eyes with just that sequence.

original: gnyis las mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /
analyzed: gnyis las mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /
translated: From the two vajra eyes, one should bend the two index fingers,

original: mig gi rnam pa lta bur sbyar nas bcings pa ni dpal rdo rje spyan no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam pa lta bur sbyar nas bcings pa ni dpal rdo rje spyan no //
translated: The binding of the eyes is the glorious Vajra Eye.

original: grub pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is perfection.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rdo rje spyan gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rdo rje spyan gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By this means that one will accomplish all the Buddhas, etc. with the Vajra Eye.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa ste /

original: de rnams dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: One should bring them under one's power.

original: des na de dag kun gyi phyag rgya 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag kun gyi phyag rgya 'di dag yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are the seals of all of them.

original: rdo rje can gyi phyag rgya ni rdo rje sems dpa' de nyid kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi phyag rgya ni rdo rje sems dpa' de nyid kyi yang yin no //
translated: The seal of the Vajra Holder is also that of Vajrasattva himself.

original: rdo rje thal mo sbyar la mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo sbyar la mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /
translated: One should join the vajra palms, bend the two index fingers,

original: mthe bong gnyis bar du bcug pa ni /
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis bar du bcug pa ni /
translated: and insert the two thumbs in between.

original: gtsug tor thams cad dang rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa yi'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor thams cad dang rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa yi'o //
translated: This is the usnīsa of all the Buddhas and Vairocana with his retinue.

original: gyen du dbye ni zhes bya ba rdo rje thal mo sbyar nas gzhag pa las de nyid kyi sor mo rnams gyen du phyen nas mdzub mo gnyis bkug la mthe bong gnyis mthe ba 'dra bar 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: gyen du dbye ni zhes bya ba rdo rje thal mo sbyar nas gzhag pa las de nyid kyi sor mo rnams gyen du phyen nas mdzub mo gnyis bkug la mthe bong gnyis mthe ba 'dra bar 'jog pa ste /
translated: The upward-dividing mudra is formed by joining the vajra palms together and then separating the fingers upward, bending the two index fingers, and placing the two thumbs like a bird's wings.

original: 'di ni he ru ka dang de'i lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni he ru ka dang de'i lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: This is for Heruka and his goddesses.

original: rmongs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni brgyal bar byed pa'o //🔽rdo rje thal mo mnyam par sbyar nas /
analyzed: rmongs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni brgyal bar byed pa'o // rdo rje thal mo mnyam par sbyar nas /
translated: The bewildering mudra is the one that causes fainting.🔽The lotus king with retinue mudra is formed by joining the vajra palms together,

original: gung mo gnyis mnyam par byas la mthe bod dang mthe'u chung kha phye ba ni padma'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa yi'o //🔽mdzub mo mnyam par phyir bkug ste /
analyzed: gung mo gnyis mnyam par byas la mthe bod dang mthe'u chung kha phye ba ni padma'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa yi'o // mdzub mo mnyam par phyir bkug ste /

original: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis mnyam par byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis mnyam par byas te /
translated: The equalized index fingers turned outward mudra is formed by equalizing the two index fingers

original: phyir rol nas bkug pa'o //🔽mthe bo rdo rje g-yogs pa ni //
analyzed: phyir rol nas bkug pa'o // mthe bo rdo rje g-yogs pa ni //

original: zhes bya ba ni mthe bo gnyis rdo rje byas la de'i rtse mo gnyis rtse sbyar nas rjes su bcings pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthe bo gnyis rdo rje byas la de'i rtse mo gnyis rtse sbyar nas rjes su bcings pa ste /
translated: The vajra-covered thumbs mudra is formed by making the two thumbs into a vajra and joining the tips of the two thumbs, and then binding them.

original: 'di ni rdo rje ma lha mo dang bcas pa yi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje ma lha mo dang bcas pa yi'o //
translated: This is the mudra of Vajra Woman.

original: mthe'u chung srin lag mnyam par sbyar ;🔽/ zhes bya ba ni mthe'u chung srid lag dang bcas pa brkyang ba ni rkang pa bzhi yi'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung srin lag mnyam par sbyar ; / zhes bya ba ni mthe'u chung srid lag dang bcas pa brkyang ba ni rkang pa bzhi yi'o //
translated: The little fingers and ring fingers are joined together.🔽The little fingers and ring fingers are extended.

original: mdzub mo rtse mnyam bkug pa ni //
analyzed: mdzub mo rtse mnyam bkug pa ni //
translated: The tips of the index fingers are bent together.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis mnyam por sbyar la mgrin pa ltar phyi rol bkug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis mnyam por sbyar la mgrin pa ltar phyi rol bkug pa'o //
translated: The tips of the two index fingers are joined together and bent outward like a neck.

original: rdo rje dril bu la sogs pa rang gi phyag mtshan dang / phyag rgya 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o zhes pa'i dam tshig chen po'i phyag rgya shes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu la sogs pa rang gi phyag mtshan dang / phyag rgya 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o zhes pa'i dam tshig chen po'i phyag rgya shes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Having previously held one’s own insignia, such as the vajra and bell, and the mudra, one should bind the great seal. In order to teach the knowledge of the great pledge seal,

original: lus dang dag sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus dang dag sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the body, speech, and mind vajras,” and so on.

original: lus dang ngag dang / sems nyid rdo rje ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang / sems nyid rdo rje ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the vajras.

original: de rnams kyi lha dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lha dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
translated: They are connected with the deity because of that.

original: thams cad 'byung ba'i sbyor @99b ba yis //
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba'i sbyor @99b ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of the arising of everything,

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //🔽bdag gis lhar ni zhes pa ni bdag gi lhag pa'i lhar bdag nyid gyur pa de bzhin du sems dpa' chen po spyan drangs pa la sogs pa nas byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim pa rdzogs par byas nas de'i nga rgyal dang
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so // bdag gis lhar ni zhes pa ni bdag gi lhag pa'i lhar bdag nyid gyur pa de bzhin du sems dpa' chen po spyan drangs pa la sogs pa nas byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim pa rdzogs par byas nas de'i nga rgyal dang
translated: This is the way of the arising of everything.🔽I am the deity means that one has become the deity of one’s overlord.

original: ldan pas bsgom pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pas bsgom pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: In the same way, having invited the great being and so on, having completed the process of consecration, empowerment, and so on, one should meditate with the pride of that.

translated: In order to teach the knowledge of the yoga consort, which is endowed with the nature of union, post-union, and complete union,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kun du sbyor ba ni thams cad 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ste /

translated: The one who is endowed with the body, speech, and mind vajras that have the form and shape of the deity is the one who has the yoga of his own deity.

original: kun gyi bdag nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //

analyzed: lha mo rnams dang lhan cig tu bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: which are the means of accomplishing all powers.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes bya ba ni rim bzhin bde ba la mchog la sogs pa bzhi po'i snying po'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes bya ba ni rim bzhin bde ba la mchog la sogs pa bzhi po'i snying po'o //
translated: Jham, hum, bam, and ho are the essence mantras of the four such as supreme bliss and so on, respectively.

original: ru ta ma ta zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas byang chub kyi'o //
analyzed: ru ta ma ta zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas byang chub kyi'o //
translated: The mantra Rudramat is for the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: sma ra ra ta zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo yi'o //
analyzed: sma ra ra ta zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo yi'o //
translated: The mantra Smararat is for the wheel of the Dharma.

original: ru lu ru lu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ma'i 'o //
analyzed: ru lu ru lu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ma'i 'o //
translated: The mantra Rulu rulu is for the one who is victorious in the three worlds.

original: bla srid tya dza zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa thams cad kyi lcug ma'i'o //
analyzed: bla srid tya dza zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa thams cad kyi lcug ma'i'o //
translated: The mantra Bhitis tyaja is for the vine of all desires.

original: ta kki h'um dza zhes bya ba ni rta gdong ma'i'o //
analyzed: ta kki h'um dza zhes bya ba ni rta gdong ma'i'o //
translated: The mantra Takki hum ja is for the one with the face of a horse.

original: hu lu hu lu zhes bya ba rdo rje gtso mo'i 'o //
analyzed: hu lu hu lu zhes bya ba rdo rje gtso mo'i 'o //
translated: The mantra Hula hula is for the chief of the vajra.

original: aa la la ho zhes bya ba ni sgrol ma'i 'o //
analyzed: aa la la ho zhes bya ba ni sgrol ma'i 'o //
translated: The mantra Ala la ho is for Tara.

original: shuddha siddha darsha yam bam zhes bya ba ni thal ba rab tu 'jig pa rol pa ro langs ma'i 'o //
analyzed: shuddha siddha darsha yam bam zhes bya ba ni thal ba rab tu 'jig pa rol pa ro langs ma'i 'o //
translated: The mantra Shuddha siddha darshayam bam is for the zombie who enjoys the dissolution of ashes.

original: ka ni zhes bya ba ni gling bu ma'i 'o //
analyzed: ka ni zhes bya ba ni gling bu ma'i 'o //
translated: The mantra Kani is for the one with the flute.

original: gu ni zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig ma'i 'o //🔽h'um zhes bya ba ni rgyud dmangs kyi'o //
analyzed: gu ni zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig ma'i 'o // h'um zhes bya ba ni rgyud dmangs kyi'o //
translated: The mantra Gu ni is for the one with the single lineage.🔽The mantra Hum is for the lineage of the common people.

original: h'um zhes bya ba ni rgyud stug gi'o //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba ni rgyud stug gi'o //
translated: The mantra Hum is for the thick lineage.

original: ta keng zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rol mo'i tshig tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ta keng zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rol mo'i tshig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: The words taka ke and so forth are the words of the music.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rol mo rnams la yang ci rigs par lha mo rnams kyi rol mo dang / snying po dang rol mo'i tshig tu brjod pa dang / yi ge rnams rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rol mo rnams la yang ci rigs par lha mo rnams kyi rol mo dang / snying po dang rol mo'i tshig tu brjod pa dang / yi ge rnams rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, for the music of Vairochana and so forth, one should infer the music of the goddesses, the essence mantras, the words of the music, and the syllables as appropriate.

original: thal mo brdab pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thal mo brdab pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The demonstration of clapping the hands is as follows.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyi thal mo brdab pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyi thal mo brdab pa ste /
translated: The clapping of the hands on the path called permanent is as follows.

original: rol mo 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa'i 'o //
analyzed: rol mo 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa'i 'o //
translated: This music is of Vajrasattva.

original: rgyud kyi rnga bo che zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rnga bo che zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great drum of the tantra is as follows.

original: rnam par ma chad pa'i rol mo yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma chad pa'i rol mo yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as uninterrupted music.

original: de dag ni bde mchog la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bde mchog la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: Those are of Chakrasamvara and so forth.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: The om and so forth are of Vairochana and his retinue.

original: ko ko zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal he ru ka 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: ko ko zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal he ru ka 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: The koka and so forth are of Shri Heruka and his retinue.

original: padma padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma'i dbang phyug ma 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: padma padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma'i dbang phyug ma 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: Padmapadma and so forth are for Padma-Heruka and his retinue.

original: tram zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje nyi ma 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: tram zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje nyi ma 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: Tram and so forth are for Vajrasūrya and his retinue.

original: ta ke h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal rta mchog gi'o //
analyzed: ta ke h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpal rta mchog gi'o //
translated: Ta ke hūṃ and so forth are for glorious Hayagrīva.

original: bsnyems pa'i 'gros so @102b zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi ni zhal bzhi nyams dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'brel pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyems pa'i 'gros so @102b zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi ni zhal bzhi nyams dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'brel pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The four beginning with the gait of pride should be known as connected with the four faces and moods.

original: rdo rje se gol gtogs pa yis //
analyzed: rdo rje se gol gtogs pa yis //
translated: By snapping the vajra fingers,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bsdu bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i gar gi phyag rgya shes pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bsdu bar bya // zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i gar gi phyag rgya shes pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: all buddhas are summoned.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the occasion of knowing the mudrā of dance stated thus, [the Bhagavān] declares vajrasattva and so forth.

original: g-yon pa'i se gol brdabs pa ni g-yon pa'i thal mo'i //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i se gol brdabs pa ni g-yon pa'i thal mo'i //
translated: Snapping the left fingers is with the left palm.

original: thal mo dal bus brdabs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni g-yas dang g-yon gnyis dus gcig se gol brdabs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: thal mo dal bus brdabs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni g-yas dang g-yon gnyis dus gcig se gol brdabs pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The slow clapping of the palms and so forth refers to the simultaneous snapping of the right and left [hands].🔽 That is the gathering.

original: de nyid ni bsdu ba zhes bya'o //🔽de lam gyi tshul bzhin 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de nyid ni bsdu ba zhes bya'o // de lam gyi tshul bzhin 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni //
translated: That is called the gathering.🔽 The following of the path and so forth

original: ji ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i lam bzhi dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i lam bzhi dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: refers to the four paths of permanence and so forth, which are in accordance with the four mudras.

original: rdo rje drag po ni dpal he ku ka'o //
analyzed: rdo rje drag po ni dpal he ku ka'o //
translated: The vajra wrath is glorious Heruka.

original: sh'a kya thub pa ni bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a kya thub pa ni bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The sage of the Shakyas is the Tathagata.

original: aa ra lo thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: aa ra lo thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: All Arahas are Vajrasattva.

original: rtag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The permanent is Vairochana.

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of all things,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: it is said.

original: mngon par brtson pa la sogs te /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa la sogs te /
translated: The ardent and so forth🔽are the various ways of abiding, such as moving, teaching, delighting, and so forth.

original: rnam par rgyu ba dang / bstan pa dang / dga' ba la sogs pa ci rigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'i khyad par 'di dag gi nyams dang ldan pas nye bar gnas shing byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: rnam par rgyu ba dang / bstan pa dang / dga' ba la sogs pa ci rigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'i khyad par 'di dag gi nyams dang ldan pas nye bar gnas shing byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: Endowed with the experience of these, they abide and bless.

original: de dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: Like that,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la /
translated: The glorious Vajrasattva and so forth of all things

original: rang gi mchod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bskul bas na /
analyzed: rang gi mchod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bskul bas na /
translated: are invoked with the words my offerings and so forth.

original: 'dir yang dkyil 'khor bsdus pa yin par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dkyil 'khor bsdus pa yin par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: Here also, the mandala should be inferred to be dissolved.

original: de ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin du bris la /
translated: The mandala of glorious Vajrasattva is drawn as before.

original: dbus kyi re'u cha la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bri /
analyzed: dbus kyi re'u cha la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bri /
translated: In the central square, the mandala of Vajrasattva is drawn.

original: shar la sogs pa'i re'u cha rnams su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi po'i 'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i re'u cha rnams su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi po'i 'o //
translated: In the squares of the east and so forth, the four beginning with Vairocana are drawn.

original: shar lho mtshams kyi re'u cha la dpal rta mchog gi'o //🔽lho nub la sogs pa'o re'u cha rnams la rdo rje gtso bo la sogs pa rnams dgod do //
analyzed: shar lho mtshams kyi re'u cha la dpal rta mchog gi'o // lho nub la sogs pa'o re'u cha rnams la rdo rje gtso bo la sogs pa rnams dgod do //
translated: In the southeast square, that of glorious Hayagrīva is drawn.🔽In the southwest and so forth, the squares are arranged with Vajraketu and so forth.

original: phyi rol gyi ri mo ni nang gi shar lho la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su ni gling bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ri mo ni nang gi shar lho la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su ni gling bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The outer lines are in the southeast and so forth, with the flute and so forth.

original: de bzhin du phyi mtshams su ni me tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi mtshams su ni me tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, in the outer boundary, there are flowers, etc.

original: shar phyogs la sogs pa'o sgo rnams su ni lcags khyu ma la sogs dgod do //
analyzed: shar phyogs la sogs pa'o sgo rnams su ni lcags khyu ma la sogs dgod do //
translated: In the east, etc., directions, there are the gates, etc., and the iron hook, etc.

original: de nas bsdu ba la sogs pa bya ste /🔽'jug pa @103a * //
analyzed: de nas bsdu ba la sogs pa bya ste / 'jug pa @103a * //
translated: Then, one should perform the gathering, etc.

original: la sogs pa'i cho ga mngon par rdzogs nas nyams dang ldan pas phyag rgya dang / lan gyi phyag rgya dang bcas par gar gyi mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i cho ga mngon par rdzogs nas nyams dang ldan pas phyag rgya dang / lan gyi phyag rgya dang bcas par gar gyi mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Having completed the rite of entering, etc., one should perform the worship with dance, together with the seal and the counter-seal.

original: phyag rgya dang gar gyi mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang gar gyi mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the seal and the dance worship,

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the union with the seal, etc.

original: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //
translated: These refers to those explained below.

original: rang gi mchod pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mchod pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i mchod pa'o //
translated: One's own worship is the worship of one's own great seal.

original: phyag rgya phyag rgya'i lan rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya phyag rgya'i lan rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
translated: The seals and the counter-seals, etc.

original: rgol ba dang slar rgol ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgol ba dang slar rgol ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis so //
translated: are the great seals associated with the debate, the response to the debate, etc.

original: ji ltar rab tu sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu sbyar zhe na /
translated: How is it applied?

original: kun tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “all, etc. ”

original: kun gyi slob dpon ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi slob dpon no //
analyzed: kun gyi slob dpon ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi slob dpon no //
translated: “All masters” are the masters of all mandalas.

original: kun 'byung la sogs sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: kun 'byung la sogs sbyor ba yis //
translated: “By the application of origination, etc.”

original: zhes pa ni sngar bshad zin to //🔽gar byas te gar rtsom par byed pas bdag nyid ji srid du kun du sna tshogs skal bzang po ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar bshad zin to // gar byas te gar rtsom par byed pas bdag nyid ji srid du kun du sna tshogs skal bzang po ste /
translated: has been explained above.🔽“Dancing” is the beginning of dancing.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “As long as one is fortunate” is as long as one is like the seal of Vajrasattva.

original: rgol ba ni slob dpon gyi lus las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgol ba ni slob dpon gyi lus las byung ba ste /
translated: “The opponent” arises from the body of the master.

original: des sangs rgyas thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya chen por rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya chen por rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: “By that, all buddhas arise” is the great seal of Vairocana.

original: slar rgol ba ni slob dpon te /🔽rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i bsgyur zhes pa'am //
analyzed: slar rgol ba ni slob dpon te / rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i bsgyur zhes pa'am //
translated: “The opponent again” is the master.🔽“The transformation of the great Vajra Holder”

original: dpal he ru ka'i phyag rgya chen por ro ;
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i phyag rgya chen por ro ;
translated: or the great seal of glorious Heruka.

original: / rang gi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: / rang gi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: “One’s own element” is the great seal of Vajrasattva.

original: de bzhin du lha mo thams cad kyi sbyor ba la ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha mo thams cad kyi sbyor ba la ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should apply the song of all the goddesses as appropriate.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i glu'i //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i glu'i //
translated: The song of Vajrasattva, etc.

original: la lar dri med ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: la lar dri med ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
translated: In some places, “stainless,” etc. is the invocation through Vajrasattva.

original: la lar rab tu 'jigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: la lar rab tu 'jigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: In some places, “very frightening,” etc.

original: dpal he ru ka'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i sgo nas so //
translated: is through Śrī Heruka.

original: la lar mdangs bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: la lar mdangs bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas so //
translated: In some places, “beautiful radiance,” etc. is through Vairocana.

original: la lar 'gro ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: la lar 'gro ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi sgo nas so //
translated: In some places, “all beings,” etc. is through Padmanarteśvara.

original: gsung mchog tu ldan par ston zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rdo rje nyi ma'i sgo nas so //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsung mchog tu ldan par ston zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rdo rje nyi ma'i sgo nas so // rdo rje sems dpa' bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: “The supreme speech is taught” is through Vajrasūrya.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rta mchog gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rta mchog gi sgo nas so //
translated: “In order to accomplish Vajrasattva,” etc. is through Hayagrīva.

original: lha mo rnams kyi glu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyi glu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the songs of the goddesses,

original: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The many forms,” and so on.

original: sems can rnam pa mang po gdul ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnam pa mang po gdul ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to tame the many forms of sentient beings,

original: gang gi tshul @103b rnams ni rnam pa mang po gdul bar mdzad pa'i tshul te /
analyzed: gang gi tshul @103b rnams ni rnam pa mang po gdul bar mdzad pa'i tshul te /
translated: the many forms are the many ways of taming.

original: rnam par sel ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la rab tu sbyor ba des gar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sel ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la rab tu sbyor ba des gar mdzad pa'o //
translated: By that, [the Bhagavān] dances, applying himself to the activities of dispelling and so on.

original: de la dag pa'i gar ni padma'i dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de la dag pa'i gar ni padma'i dam tshig ste /
translated: Among them, the pure dance is the lotus commitment.

original: gar gi dbang phyug sangs rgyas khyed rnams gar mkhan yin pas gar mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: gar gi dbang phyug sangs rgyas khyed rnams gar mkhan yin pas gar mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: O you who are the lords of dance, the buddhas, dance!

original: rnam pa mang po'i bde ba'i mchog gi rab tu gar mdzad pas de las thar pa rnams nyon mongs pa med pa thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po'i bde ba'i mchog gi rab tu gar mdzad pas de las thar pa rnams nyon mongs pa med pa thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: By dancing the supreme bliss of many forms, those liberated attain the state of being free from afflictions.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor so so'i rdo rje'i glu'i mchod pa'i phyag rgyas shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor so so'i rdo rje'i glu'i mchod pa'i phyag rgyas shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the knowledge of the mudrā of worship through the vajra song of each of the maṇḍalas, such as Vajrasattva,

original: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The utterly joyful,” and so on.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The one who is very joyful is Vajrasattva.

original: rjes su chags pa ni de la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa ni de la dga' ba'o //
translated: The one who is passionate is the one who delights in that.

original: de nyid ni mda' dang gzhu yin la rab tu phra ba'i phyir phyag rgya de gnyis kyi phra ba'i rgyas btab pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mda' dang gzhu yin la rab tu phra ba'i phyir phyag rgya de gnyis kyi phra ba'i rgyas btab pa ste /
translated: That very one is the arrow and the bow, and because of being very subtle, he is sealed by the seal of the subtlety of those two.

original: de ni bde ba'i mchog gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i mchog gi ngo bos so //
translated: That is by the nature of the supreme bliss.

original: padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'khor dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: This refers to Padmanarteshvara and his retinue.

translated: The line to the infinite world and so forth refers to the face of the hero at the back.🔽The line in some places, very certain and so forth refers to the face of the peaceful one on the left.

analyzed: la lar rab tu 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang po'i sgeg pa'i zhal gyi sgo nas so /

original: thams cad dbang bskur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad dbang bskur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /

analyzed: bdud thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i lha mo bzhi'i sgo nas bskul ba'i glu ste /

original: rdo rje nyi ma'i 'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'i 'o //

original: la lar mkhas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: la lar mkhas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /

original: rta mchog zhal bzhi'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: rta mchog zhal bzhi'i sgo nas bskul ba'o //

analyzed: mchod pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya shes ba nye bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the seal of all offerings,

analyzed: me tog dkar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, white flowers, etc.

analyzed: ljang gu zhes bya ba ni kha dog ljang ba'o //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya bas ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: ro dhi ni rdo dreg go //

analyzed: ka bi tsa bcas zhes bya ba ni rtsndan dang tu ru skar bcas pa'o //

original: rdo rje can la zhes bya ba ni rta mchog can no //
analyzed: rdo rje can la zhes bya ba ni rta mchog can no //

analyzed: gtor ma'i phyag rgya shes pa bstan pa'i phyir //

analyzed: sgeg mo dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sgeg mo ni 'bru chang ngo //

original: myong dang ni bu ra ma chang ngo //
analyzed: myong dang ni bu ra ma chang ngo //

original: bdud rtsi ni rkun chang ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi ni rkun chang ngo //

analyzed: gcig phu dpa' ba ni rgun chu'i btung ba'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags sri ni tsha'o //

analyzed: phyugs chen po ni skyes bu phyugs chen no //

original: rdo rje las ni he ru @104b ka'o ;
analyzed: rdo rje las ni he ru @104b ka'o ;

original: / thang pa zhes bya ba ni thang gi phyogs nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: / thang pa zhes bya ba ni thang gi phyogs nas byung ba'o //
translated: The plain is the one arisen from the plain.

original: sha'i mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha'i mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme flesh is

original: sha'i mchog dag go //
analyzed: sha'i mchog dag go //
translated: the supreme flesh.
