analyzed: phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya shes pa dag nye par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the knowledge of the mudra consecration seal,

original: mthe bo sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rdo rje thal mo sbyar la mthe bong g-yon pa g-yas pas sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gi tshul du mnan la mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste gung mo gnyis mnyam par sbyar la tshigs gnyis par lcags kyu'i tshul du gzhag sor mo lhag ma rdo rje thal mo'i tshul
analyzed: mthe bo sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rdo rje thal mo sbyar la mthe bong g-yon pa g-yas pas sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gi tshul du mnan la mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste gung mo gnyis mnyam par sbyar la tshigs gnyis par lcags kyu'i tshul du gzhag sor mo lhag ma rdo rje thal mo'i tshul
translated: he declares the thumb is the hero, etc.

original: du gzhag go //
analyzed: du gzhag go //
translated: Having joined the vajra palms, one should press down the left thumb with the right in the manner of the sattva posture, and having bent the two index fingers, one should join the two middle fingers, placing them in the manner of a hook at the second joint, and the remaining fingers should be placed in the manner of the vajra palms.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen phyag rgya 'di ni spyi bor ni rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar po byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya can /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen phyag rgya 'di ni spyi bor ni rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar po byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya can /
translated: This precious buddha seal is on the crown, white Vairochana with the mudra of supreme enlightenment.

original: dpral ba'i steng du mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: dpral ba'i steng du mi bskyod pa /
translated: Above the forehead is Akṣhobhya,

original: sku mdog dkar pos gnon gyi phyag rgya can gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dkar pos gnon gyi phyag rgya can gyis brgyan pa /
translated: white in color, adorned with the mudra of subjugation.

original: g-yas su rin chen 'byung ldan beed'u rgya'i mdog can mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
analyzed: g-yas su rin chen 'byung ldan beed'u rgya'i mdog can mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
translated: To the right is Ratnasaṃbhava, the color of a beryl, with the mudra of generosity.

original: rgyab tu 'od dpag med gser btso ma'i mdog can chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgyab tu 'od dpag med gser btso ma'i mdog can chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
translated: To the rear is Amitābha, the color of refined gold, with the mudra of the dharma wheel.

original: g-yon du don yon grub pa sku mdog ljang gu ma'i 'jigs pa rab tu stsol pa bskyed la /
analyzed: g-yon du don yon grub pa sku mdog ljang gu ma'i 'jigs pa rab tu stsol pa bskyed la /
translated: To the left is Amoghasiddhi, green in color, with the mudra of granting freedom from fear.

original: aom aa bhi shinytsa ma'm zhes brjod la dbang bskur te /
analyzed: aom aa bhi shinytsa ma'm zhes brjod la dbang bskur te /
translated: Say oṃ abhiṣiñca maṃ and confer empowerment.

original: da ra dpyangs kyi mtha' yang ba ltar byas pa sngon du 'gro bas 'gying zhing mtha' nas dgrol ba byas la thal mos brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: da ra dpyangs kyi mtha' yang ba ltar byas pa sngon du 'gro bas 'gying zhing mtha' nas dgrol ba byas la thal mos brtan par bya'o //
translated: With the preliminaries of hanging the chin down and shaking it, sway and loosen from the end, and stabilize with the palms.

original: ser mo thams cad nang du bsnol //
analyzed: ser mo thams cad nang du bsnol //
translated: All the fingers are crossed in.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcing ba nang du byas pa la sor mo thams cad nang du bsnol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcing ba nang du byas pa la sor mo thams cad nang du bsnol ba'o //
translated: This means that all the fingers are crossed in, having been bound inside.

original: sor mo'i rtse mo kun sprad nas /
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mo kun sprad nas /
translated: The tips of all the fingers are joined together.

original: zhes bya ba ni sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo phan tshun bsnol ba'i ngos sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo phan tshun bsnol ba'i ngos sbyar ba'o //
translated: This means that the tips of all the fingers are joined together, touching each other.

original: mthe bong rdo rje mnan pa ni //
analyzed: mthe bong rdo rje mnan pa ni //
translated: The vajra-pressing of the thumbs.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rjer byas pa'i mthe bos steng nas mnan pa'o //🔽sna dang mig sbubs lta bu ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rjer byas pa'i mthe bos steng nas mnan pa'o // sna dang mig sbubs lta bu ste //
translated: This means that the thumbs are made into vajras and press down above.🔽Like the cavity of the nose and eyes.

original: zhes bya ba ni sna dang mig gi sbubs kyi bu ga 'dra ba'o //🔽'di la yang h'um aa bhishi nytsa ma'm //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sna dang mig gi sbubs kyi bu ga 'dra ba'o // 'di la yang h'um aa bhishi nytsa ma'm //
translated: This means like the cavity of the nose and eyes.

original: zhes bya bas dbang bskur la thal mo'i mthar thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas dbang bskur la thal mo'i mthar thug gi bar du'o //
translated: Here also, one should empower oneself with “Hum abhishiñca maṃ,” and so on, up to the end of the palms.

original: phyag rgya gnyis po de dag ni rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa'i 'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gnyis po de dag ni rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa'i 'o //
translated: These two mudras are of Vajrasattva and his retinue.

original: rdo rje thal mo bcings nas rdo rje rin po che bya ba ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa'i ste /🔽aa bhi shinytsa ma'm /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo bcings nas rdo rje rin po che bya ba ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa'i ste / aa bhi shinytsa ma'm /
translated: Having formed the vajra-palms, the vajra-jewel is the mudra of glorious Vairochana and his retinue.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //🔽dpal he ru ka'i rdo rje rang gi snying gar bya ba sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro // dpal he ru ka'i rdo rje rang gi snying gar bya ba sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The consecration is abhisinca ma.

original: aa bhi shinytsa ma'm zhes bya bas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: aa bhi shinytsa ma'm zhes bya bas dbang bskur ro //
translated: The consecration of glorious Heruka is abhisinca ma with the vajra at one's heart.

original: @105a * // gnyis pa yang thod pa'i phreng ba cod pan gyi phyag rgya rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: @105a * // gnyis pa yang thod pa'i phreng ba cod pan gyi phyag rgya rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'brel ba ste /
translated: The second is the crown mudra of the garland of skulls, connected with Vajrasattva.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' padma'i nor bu che'i dbu rgyan zhes bya ba 'di'i ming gi rnam pa'o //🔽rang gi snying po la aa bhishinytsa ma'm /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' padma'i nor bu che'i dbu rgyan zhes bya ba 'di'i ming gi rnam pa'o // rang gi snying po la aa bhishinytsa ma'm /
translated: The name of this is the crown of the great lotus jewel of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya bas dbang bskur ro //🔽mthe bong dang dpa' bo'i skyil mo krung /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dbang bskur ro // mthe bong dang dpa' bo'i skyil mo krung /
translated: The consecration is abhisinca ma with one's essence.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba byas la mthe bong bcing pa byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba byas la mthe bong bcing pa byas te /
translated: The hero's cross-legged posture is the vajra-palms joined, with the thumbs bound.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin gzhag go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin gzhag go //
translated: The rest are to be placed as before.

original: 'di zhes pa ni aa bhi shinytsa ma'm zhes padma'i dbang phyug 'khor dang bcas pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni aa bhi shinytsa ma'm zhes padma'i dbang phyug 'khor dang bcas pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: This is abhiṣiñcāmī, I confer empowerment with the lotus lord and retinue.

original: rdo rje thal mo mnyam bar sbyar la mthe bong gnyis mnyam par byas pa brkyang la mdzub mo bsnyams te rtse mo bkug la mthe bong gi rtse mo dang spyar te /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo mnyam bar sbyar la mthe bong gnyis mnyam par byas pa brkyang la mdzub mo bsnyams te rtse mo bkug la mthe bong gi rtse mo dang spyar te /
translated: The vajra palms are joined, the two thumbs are even, extended, the index fingers are even, the tips are bent, and the tips of the thumbs are joined.

original: rin po cher byas pa ni dpal rdo rje nor bu'i phyag rgya bya ste /
analyzed: rin po cher byas pa ni dpal rdo rje nor bu'i phyag rgya bya ste /
translated: The jewel is made by the mudra of glorious vajra gem.

original: rdo rje nyi ma 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The vajra sun is with retinue.

original: 'di dang aa bhi shinytsa zhes bya ba dang dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: 'di dang aa bhi shinytsa zhes bya ba dang dbang bskur ro //
translated: This and abhiṣiñcāmī are I confer empowerment.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen zhes bya ba ni cod pa na lnga pa rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'brel ba'o /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen zhes bya ba ni cod pa na lnga pa rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'brel ba'o /

analyzed: rdo rje rin chen chen po zhes bya ba ni ;

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: rdo rje bcing pa'i nang du phan tshun bsgyel nas gzhag pa'i nang du'o //

analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje phyag rgya ste /

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa'i @105b sems kyi gsang ba skul bar byed pa'o // de las zhes bya ba ni dga' ba chen po bde ba'i rdo rje las so //

analyzed: gsang ba'i dam tshig rdo rje'i 'khor lo rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang pa'i'o //

original: rdo rje padma zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje padma zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //

analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis legs par sbyar ba'o //

analyzed: rdo rje mda' ni yongs su 'phangs //

translated: This is done in the manner of shooting an arrow.🔽This is the mudra of the vajra sun together with its retinue.🔽The vajra mudra is

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: bstod pa dang bcas pa'i ming gi phyag rgya shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the mudra of the name with praise,

analyzed: a'a li ka'i li zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phreng ngo //

analyzed: mnyam pa ni mtshungs pa'o // kha yi thad kar mdud par bya //

original: zhes bya ba ni //

analyzed: yi ge bri ba 'dis /

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor ba //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming tsam bris pas kyang sdig ba kun las thar bar 'gyur zhing bde ba thams cad las sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and so forth. By writing just the names, one will be freed from all sins and united with all happiness.

original: la la na re a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: la la na re a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some say that the letters means

analyzed: ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'i bye brag gis mnyam po gnyis sa su byas la /

analyzed: yi ge aa yi ge pa'i kha'i thad kar ri mos mdud par byas nas /

analyzed: yi ge thams cad dgod par bya //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

translated: having drawn in the letters ka, etc., one should meditate on the bodhicitta in the form of a moon disk by emanating them in the form of light rays.

analyzed: zla ba phyed dang bcas pa ni klad kor dang bcas pa'i ra ni //
translated: The half-moon is the ra with a head mark.

analyzed: 'dir chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid du bsam mo zhes rtogs par byed do //
translated: Here, one should understand that it is conceived as the essence of the dharmadhatu.

translated: Also, the syllable ra, which is the nature of wisdom and method, melts into fire and creates the complete maṇḍala on the multicolored lotus. Since the syllable ka and so on are placed here with light rays, the multicolored is generated, emanated, and gathered.🔽

original: ba la sogs pa ci lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa ci lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Also, the syllable ra, which is the nature of wisdom and means, melts with the fire of ra. Having completed the maṇḍala located in the variegated lotus, one should generate the variegated [maṇḍala] here by placing the light rays together with the ka and so on, and one should emanate and gather [the light rays] as one likes.

original: de ltar bshad pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: Thus, those explanations and so on are mere concepts.

original: nang du yi ge bri ba'i gnas skabs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nang du yi ge bri ba'i gnas skabs ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the syllables are written inwardly.

analyzed: bstod pa dang bcas pa'i ming gi dbang du byas pa'i don dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: [The syllables] are not related to the meaning that is the basis of the name together with the praise.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal gyi lha //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal gyi lha //
translated: The glorious deity of Vajrasattva

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: and so on is the teaching.🔽The glorious union of Vajrasattva

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor zhe bya ba ni rim gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor zhe bya ba ni rim gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: is the gradual explanation.

analyzed: rab tu chags pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i sgras mtshan pa'o //
translated: The so-called “great passion” is indicated by the word “passion.”

translated: The phrase if one writes the name means that the merit of writing them just as they are, the best of names, and likewise, of reciting them, and of practicing them, is also [the same].

original: bri ba dang gdon par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: bri ba dang gdon par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: And it is not only writing and reciting that are [to be done] in this way.

original: dkyil 'khor du ming gis bsang bskur ba'i tshe yang dpal gyi sgras mtshan par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir lhag pa'i lha ni zhes bya ba la sogs @106b pa gsungs so //

translated: In order to teach that when one is consecrated by name in the mandala, one should be consecrated with the word 'splendor', [the Bhagavān] declares the 'exalted deity', etc.

original: lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The 'exalted deity' is Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de'i mtshan zhes bya ba ni //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa thams cad dpal gyis gas mtshan par byas te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan zhes bya ba ni // rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa thams cad dpal gyis gas mtshan par byas te /
translated: His 'name' is🔽'Vajrasattva', etc.

original: rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes ba'o //
translated: One should consecrate all of them with the word 'splendor', and should consecrate them with the vajra name.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming rnams dang yon len pa sngon du 'gro bas bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya bcings la //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming rnams dang yon len pa sngon du 'gro bas bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya bcings la //
translated: The name Glorious Vajrasattva and so forth, and having received the gift, one should form the mudra of consecration as oneself, and say:

original: aom 'di ltar nga yis lung bstan te /
analyzed: aom 'di ltar nga yis lung bstan te /
translated: Om, thus I prophesy:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva Tathagata,

original: ngan 'gro rnams las yongs bzlas la //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams las yongs bzlas la //
translated: completely liberated from the lower realms,

original: shin tu srid pa sgrub pa po //🔽kye che ge mo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa siddhi sa ma ya tram bhur bhur ba sva:/
analyzed: shin tu srid pa sgrub pa po // kye che ge mo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa siddhi sa ma ya tram bhur bhur ba sva:/
translated: you will accomplish existence.

analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The name of the disciple is inserted here, and one should say: Vajra Tathagata, Siddhi Samaya Tram Bhur Bhurva svaha!

analyzed: mi smra ba las mos pa rnams kyis bzlas brjod kyi dus su brda'i tha snyad bya ba'i don du brda'i phyag rgya shes pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the knowledge of the symbolic mudra for the purpose of symbolic communication at the time of the recitation by those who are devoted to silence, it is said:

original: spyi bor nyug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: spyi bor nyug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Rubbing on the head and so forth.

original: smin ma g-yas pa bskul ba ni nam mkhar 'gro ba grub po zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: smin ma g-yas pa bskul ba ni nam mkhar 'gro ba grub po zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The stimulation of the right eyebrow indicates the accomplishment of flying in the sky.

original: g-yon pas rnam par rgyal ba'i mchog ni dngos grub rab tu grub par ro //
analyzed: g-yon pas rnam par rgyal ba'i mchog ni dngos grub rab tu grub par ro //
translated: With the left, the supreme victory is the accomplishment of the highest power.

original: yang mig g-yon pa bskul ba ni bud med bzang mo yin no zhes ba dang / g-yas pas ni skyes pa bzang po'i'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: yang mig g-yon pa bskul ba ni bud med bzang mo yin no zhes ba dang / g-yas pas ni skyes pa bzang po'i'o zhes ston to //
translated: Moreover, the stimulation of the left eye indicates a good woman, and the stimulation of the right eye indicates a good man.

original: rna ba g-yas pa la reg pas ni sha zhes zer ba yin la /
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa la reg pas ni sha zhes zer ba yin la /
translated: Touching the right ear is said to be meat,

original: g-yon pas ni chang zhes zer ba yin no /
analyzed: g-yon pas ni chang zhes zer ba yin no /
translated: and the left ear is said to be beer.

original: ma mchu g-yon pa ni gnon pa ni bde ba la reg pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma mchu g-yon pa ni gnon pa ni bde ba la reg pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Pressing down on the left lip is said to be touching bliss.

original: lkog ma la reg pa ni rtog pa thams cad smra ba'i mchog ste /
analyzed: lkog ma la reg pa ni rtog pa thams cad smra ba'i mchog ste /
translated: Touching the throat is the supreme speech of all concepts,

original: rtog pa thams cad smra zhing theg pa chen po bla na med pa zhes bya ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad smra zhing theg pa chen po bla na med pa zhes bya ba ston pa yin no //
translated: indicating the teaching of the Great Vehicle, the unsurpassed.

original: snying gar gyen du 'dren ma ni rdo rje thams cad gyen du 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar gyen du 'dren ma ni rdo rje thams cad gyen du 'dren pa'o //
translated: Drawing up at the heart is the drawing up of all vajras.

original: 'khor ba shin tu sdud pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su 'dzin pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba shin tu sdud pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su 'dzin pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: The complete gathering of samsara is said to be the upholding of non-abiding nirvana.

original: lte ba la reg pas nyid bu ma'i lam la nan tan du bsgrubs pas chos kyi 'khor lo chen po'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: lte ba la reg pas nyid bu ma'i lam la nan tan du bsgrubs pas chos kyi 'khor lo chen po'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: By touching the navel, one should practice with the path of the daughter, and thus the maṇḍala of the great wheel of Dharma.

original: rang gi dbang po zhes bya ba ni skyes ba'i sgreng bar byed pa ni bde zhing bde bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thams cad thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi dbang po zhes bya ba ni skyes ba'i sgreng bar byed pa ni bde zhing bde bas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thams cad thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: One’s own organ is the male organ. By erecting it, one will attain all the joys of buddhahood.

original: g-yas pa ni bstod pa dang dgug pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni bstod pa dang dgug pa'o //
translated: The right [hand] is for praising and summoning.

original: g-yon pa ni slar gtong pa'o /
analyzed: g-yon pa ni slar gtong pa'o /
translated: The left is for sending back.

original: dbung ba g-yas pas yongs su 'khyud pa ni thams cad grub pa yin zhes smra ba yin @107a * //
analyzed: dbung ba g-yas pas yongs su 'khyud pa ni thams cad grub pa yin zhes smra ba yin @107a * //
translated: The embrace with the right arm is said to be for all accomplishments.

original: la ; g-yon pas ni dbang phyug thams cad grub pa yin no zhes smra ba yin no //🔽lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur bcangs pa ni rgyas thob shig pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: la ; g-yon pas ni dbang phyug thams cad grub pa yin no zhes smra ba yin no // lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur bcangs pa ni rgyas thob shig pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The left is said to be for the accomplishment of all powers.🔽The right hand in a fist is the manner of “give me the boon.”

original: g-yon pa bkrol ba ni thang shing pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa bkrol ba ni thang shing pa'o //
translated: The left hand is extended.

original: brla g-yon pa rab tu brdabs pas ni 'dod pa chen po la shin tu brtson pa yin la g-yas pas ni chos la brtson par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: brla g-yon pa rab tu brdabs pas ni 'dod pa chen po la shin tu brtson pa yin la g-yas pas ni chos la brtson par ston pa yin no //
translated: By striking the left thigh, one shows great desire and great effort; by striking the right, one shows effort in the Dharma.

original: pus mo'i lha da g-yon pa la brdabs pa ni mdud pa yin la /🔽g-yas pas phyag 'tshal ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: pus mo'i lha da g-yon pa la brdabs pa ni mdud pa yin la / g-yas pas phyag 'tshal ba ston pa yin no //
translated: By striking the left knee, one shows a knot;🔽by striking the right, one shows a salutation.

original: dbyig pa g-yas pa rab tu brdabs pa ni rgyas 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyig pa g-yas pa rab tu brdabs pa ni rgyas 'debs pa'o //
translated: By striking the right arm, one shows a seal;

original: g-yon pas ni grol zhig par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yon pas ni grol zhig par ston pa yin no //
translated: by striking the left, one shows release.

original: rkang ba g-yon pas sa gnon pa ni non cig pa'o //
analyzed: rkang ba g-yon pas sa gnon pa ni non cig pa'o //
translated: By stamping the left foot, one shows a stamp;

original: g-yas pa ni rab tu choms shing par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni rab tu choms shing par ston pa yin no //
translated: by stamping the right, one shows complete conquest.

original: brda'i phyag rgya 'di rnams kyi rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ji ltar rang gi brdas brtags pa rnam mkhar 'gro ba la sogs pa 'grub cing rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brda'i phyag rgya 'di rnams kyi rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas ji ltar rang gi brdas brtags pa rnam mkhar 'gro ba la sogs pa 'grub cing rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By these symbolic seals, one should accomplish and perfect the going in the sky, etc., as imagined by one’s own seal, by being endowed with the application of Vajrasattva, etc.

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba de rnams kyi tha snyad du byed bzhin pa de yis ni mi 'grub cing mngon du mi 'gyur ba yang med do //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba de rnams kyi tha snyad du byed bzhin pa de yis ni mi 'grub cing mngon du mi 'gyur ba yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not accomplished and manifested by those who are engaged in the practice of the consort.

original: dngos grub bslangs ba la sogs pa'i phyag rgya 'debs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba ci yod pa dang / rang gi don gyi lam de dag la sogs pa de rab tu 'grub cing /
analyzed: dngos grub bslangs ba la sogs pa'i phyag rgya 'debs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba ci yod pa dang / rang gi don gyi lam de dag la sogs pa de rab tu 'grub cing /
translated: The seal of the consort is the request for spiritual powers, and whatever happiness there is, such as all the enlightenments of the buddhas, and the path of one's own aim, that is accomplished and

original: de rnams rdzogs ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams rdzogs ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: that is perfected.

original: rgyud kyi don rnam par dbye ba'i phyir dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la yang gsang ba'i skad du smra ba'i don du sgra'i rnam gangs kyi brda'i ming bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don rnam par dbye ba'i phyir dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la yang gsang ba'i skad du smra ba'i don du sgra'i rnam gangs kyi brda'i ming bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to analyze the meaning of the tantra and in order to speak in secret language about the maṇḍala and so on, the names of the secret language are taught.

original: aom a'adhi bhu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: aom a'adhi bhu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Oṃ ādhīḥ and so on are stated.

original: aom a'a dhi bhu zhes bya ba la phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aom a'a dhi bhu zhes bya ba la phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Oṃ ādhīḥ is stated for the purpose of paying homage.

original: de la lan gyi sgra ni slar smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la lan gyi sgra ni slar smra ba ste /
translated: The word “reply” is speaking back.

original: lan du phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: lan du phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: In response, he utters the words of homage.

original: sems dpa' sngon dang mtha' med pa //
analyzed: sems dpa' sngon dang mtha' med pa //
translated: The hero without beginning or end

original: zhes bya ba sogs pas ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam grangs gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sogs pas ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam grangs gsungs pa ste /
translated: and so forth declares the synonyms of Vajrasattva.

original: sngon dang mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon dang mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Without beginning or end

original: yod bzhin dang po skye ba nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: yod bzhin dang po skye ba nyid med pa ste /
translated: means that, while existing, there is no origination in the beginning,

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: and no remainder in nirvana.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams dang bral bas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams dang bral bas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is free from conceptualization.

original: zag pa me dpa'i bdee ba rgyun 'chad pa'i bda gnyid du gyur pas mchog tu bde bas na /
analyzed: zag pa me dpa'i bdee ba rgyun 'chad pa'i bda gnyid du gyur pas mchog tu bde bas na /
translated: Since he is the sleep of the cessation of the bliss of the undefiled, he is supremely blissful.

original: 'di ni ae ma'o bde bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ae ma'o bde bar bya'o //
translated: This is the exclamation “Ah! Bliss!”

original: sangs rgyas @107b rnams 'dus pa'i phyag rgya yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @107b rnams 'dus pa'i phyag rgya yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Since he is the seal of the assembly of Buddhas, he is the seal of the Buddhas.

original: lha ma rnams kyi rnams kyi rnam grangs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha ma rnams kyi rnams kyi rnam grangs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the synonyms of the goddesses,

original: bde mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bde mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares “supreme bliss” and so forth.

original: bde mchog dang / ae ma bde ba dang / sgrol ma dang / shi shi'i phyag rgya la sog pa ni las kyi rgyus rgyas 'debs ma dang ; rmongs byed ma dang / za ba mo dang / tshe 'phel ma zhes bya ba rim bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: bde mchog dang / ae ma bde ba dang / sgrol ma dang / shi shi'i phyag rgya la sog pa ni las kyi rgyus rgyas 'debs ma dang ; rmongs byed ma dang / za ba mo dang / tshe 'phel ma zhes bya ba rim bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The seals of Heruka, of Ah! Bliss, of Tara, and of Sishi are taught to be the Karmamudra, the Moha, the Bhakṣi, and the Vardhani.

original: lha mo gzhan rnams ni sangs rgyas byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa ming gi rnam grangs re re nyid do //
analyzed: lha mo gzhan rnams ni sangs rgyas byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa ming gi rnam grangs re re nyid do //
translated: The other goddesses have only one name, such as Buddhabodhi.

original: gling bu la sog pa nas rdza rda'i bar gyi ming gi rna grang gling bu dang rgyud gcig pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: gling bu la sog pa nas rdza rda'i bar gyi ming gi rna grang gling bu dang rgyud gcig pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The names of the goddesses from the flute to the drum are the names of the same lineage, such as Vamśi and Ekatantrī.

original: me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams ni gla rtsi dang longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnams ni gla rtsi dang longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: The offerings of flowers, etc. are called musk, enjoyment, etc.

original: lha mo bzhi'i phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya'i bya ba bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha mo bzhi'i phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya'i bya ba bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the seal-action of the four goddesses' emblems,

original: smin ma bskyod pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: smin ma bskyod pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the eyebrows' movement, etc. are taught.

original: bde ba mchog gi mda' gzhu ste /
analyzed: bde ba mchog gi mda' gzhu ste /
translated: The supreme bliss is the bow and arrow.

original: brdegs pa'i lta ba'i bdag nyid pas smin ma bskyod pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brdegs pa'i lta ba'i bdag nyid pas smin ma bskyod pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The eyebrows are called moving because of the nature of the view of the one who is struck.

original: ae ma bde ba yi ni bha ga dang ling ga zhes bya ba mngal gyi phyag rgya dang skyes bu'i mtshan gyis mtshan pa ste /
analyzed: ae ma bde ba yi ni bha ga dang ling ga zhes bya ba mngal gyi phyag rgya dang skyes bu'i mtshan gyis mtshan pa ste /
translated: The bhaga and linga are called amazing bliss, marked by the womb seal and the male organ.

original: de bas na ae ma'o bde ba'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ae ma'o bde ba'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, amazing bliss.

original: sgrol ma'i thod pa padma yin par bshad //
analyzed: sgrol ma'i thod pa padma yin par bshad //
translated: The skull of Tara is explained as the lotus.

original: kha tv'am ga yang rgyal mtshan zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga yang rgyal mtshan zhes gsungs so //
translated: The katvanga is also said to be the victory banner.

original: shi shi'i 'di ni sangs rgyas phyag rgya padmor gnas //
analyzed: shi shi'i 'di ni sangs rgyas phyag rgya padmor gnas //
translated: This shishi is the buddha's seal, abiding in the lotus.

original: bde ba kun gyi ra sa ya na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba kun gyi ra sa ya na zhes gsungs so //
translated: All bliss is called rasa.

original: sangs rgyas ku ni shi si'i tshig gi sgras bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ku ni shi si'i tshig gi sgras bshad do //
translated: The buddha's words are explained by the term kunishi.

original: 'khor lo ni dam tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni dam tshig go //
translated: The wheel is the samaya.

original: skye bo dam pa kun tshogs pa //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa kun tshogs pa //
translated: The gathering of all holy beings

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam grangs so //
translated: is a synonym for the mandala.

original: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du yang mdza' ba thams cad tog spas na mdza' ba 'dus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du yang mdza' ba thams cad tog spas na mdza' ba 'dus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the mandala of the assembly, when all friends gather, it is called the gathering of friends.

original: de bas na she par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na she par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be known.

original: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor las gzhan dang gzhan du yang mdza' ba'i tshul dag gis dkyil 'khor ni 'di la yod do //
analyzed: tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor las gzhan dang gzhan du yang mdza' ba'i tshul dag gis dkyil 'khor ni 'di la yod do //
translated: And in other places, the mandala is said to be in this [mandala] by the method of love.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang sbyor ba gnyis su med par gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang sbyor ba gnyis su med par gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-dual union with Vajrasattva is called the mandala.

original: lha mo thams cad dang kun nas 'dus ba ni shin tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: lha mo thams cad dang kun nas 'dus ba ni shin tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The gathering together of all the goddesses is the characteristic of the union.

original: thams cad du sna tshogs pa'i skal ba bzang po zhes bya brjod do //
analyzed: thams cad du sna tshogs pa'i skal ba bzang po zhes bya brjod do //
translated: It is said to be the good fortune of all varieties.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sbyor ba //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sbyor ba //
translated: The union with Vajrasattva is

original: zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni //
translated: This is the explanation of the third chapter of the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, the chapter on the aids to liberation.

original: de'i bdag nyid du bsgom @108a * //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du bsgom @108a * //
translated: It is the meditation on his nature.

original: ba'o ; de ni sangs rgyas kun tu bdag nyid sbyor bas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba'o ; de ni sangs rgyas kun tu bdag nyid sbyor bas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is the union with the nature of all the Buddhas, as it is said.

original: sngar bshad pa ni rje su sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid yi shes sems dpa' nang du bstim pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ni rje su sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid yi shes sems dpa' nang du bstim pa'o //
translated: The previously explained knowledge being is dissolved inside.

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen shas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen shas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the knowledge of the Omniscient One,

original: zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni //
translated: This is the explanation of the third chapter of the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, the chapter on the aids to liberation.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with the best of all aspects.

original: de dang gnyis su med pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa de ni kun gyi slob pa dpon yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang gnyis su med pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa de ni kun gyi slob pa dpon yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: He who is endowed with the pride of non-duality with her is the master of all disciples.

original: gang gi tshe yang lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba mngon du byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba mngon du byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one manifests the yoga of the identity of the union with all goddesses,

original: kun gyi slob dpon du rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: kun gyi slob dpon du rab tu gnas pa ste /
translated: then one is established as the master of all.

original: kun du sna tshogs skal bzang por yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs skal bzang por yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should also know the universal variety as good fortune.

original: kun gyi slob dpon rab tu gnas pa de'i sgrub pa ni rje su sgrub ba'o //
analyzed: kun gyi slob dpon rab tu gnas pa de'i sgrub pa ni rje su sgrub ba'o //
translated: The practice of the one who is established as the master of all is the practice of the subsequent.

original: grub pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba ni rjes su sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba ni rjes su sgrub pa ste /
translated: The attainment is the consecration by the consecration of glorious Vajrasattva, which is the subsequent practice.

original: rgyal mtshan yin par rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan yin par rnam par bshad do //
translated: It is explained as the banner.

original: mchog ni kun gyi slob dpon la sogs pa slob ma'i sgrub pa'i grogs mchog go /
analyzed: mchog ni kun gyi slob dpon la sogs pa slob ma'i sgrub pa'i grogs mchog go /
translated: The supreme is the best friend of the practice of the disciple, such as the master of all.

original: mtha' ma ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: mtha' ma ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i skal ba can no //
translated: The last is the one who is fortunate to enter the mandala.

original: 'bring ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sbyor bar dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sbyor bar dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The middling is the consecration in the union with the Tathagata.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rin po che mchog gi dbu rgyan ni sang rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rin po che mchog gi dbu rgyan ni sang rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan no //
translated: The crest-jewel of all Buddhas is the crest-jewel of the five Buddhas.

original: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyal po yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyal po yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the king of all Buddhas.

original: gnyis pa ni thod pa'i phreng pa'i dbu rgyan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thod pa'i phreng pa'i dbu rgyan te /
translated: The second is the crest-jewel of the garland of skulls.

original: de ni dpal gyi padmo'i tshul du bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dpal gyi padmo'i tshul du bshad do //
translated: It is explained as the lotus of glory.🔽The one who is accomplished in the nature of the Buddhas

original: sangs rgyas rang bzhin grub gcig dang // zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gcig gis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rang bzhin grub gcig dang // zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gcig gis mtshan pa'o //
translated: is marked with one Buddha.

original: grub pa ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is well known.

original: padmo'i rang bzhin gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: padmo'i rang bzhin gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is of the nature of the lotus

original: thod pa gcig gis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: thod pa gcig gis mtshan pa'o //
translated: is marked with one skull.

original: de gnyis ni rim bzhin du sangs rgyas dbang bskur ba dang / dbang bskur ba chen po yin zhes don thams cad grub pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rim bzhin du sangs rgyas dbang bskur ba dang / dbang bskur ba chen po yin zhes don thams cad grub pas gsungs so //
translated: These two are respectively the consecration of the Buddhas and the great consecration, as Sarvarthasiddhi says.

original: yon gyi dam pa ni nor gyi dbyig thams cad dang / snying yang thams cad yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yon gyi dam pa ni nor gyi dbyig thams cad dang / snying yang thams cad yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The best of gifts is all the wealth and all the heart.

original: tsandan dmar po ga bur dang sres pa ni khrag chen po yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po ga bur dang sres pa ni khrag chen po yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that red sandalwood mixed with camphor is the great blood.

original: gzhan dag na re ni khrag nag po brjod pa ni rdo rje 'dzin gyi'o /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni khrag nag po brjod pa ni rdo rje 'dzin gyi'o /
translated: Others say that the black blood is that of Vajradhara,

original: la la ni ga bur dang ldan par 'dod do //
analyzed: la la ni ga bur dang ldan par 'dod do //
translated: and some assert that it is mixed with camphor.

original: de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gzhag pa ni dpal thams cad dang @108b ldan pa'i ra sa ya na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gzhag pa ni dpal thams cad dang @108b ldan pa'i ra sa ya na zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that the one placed in the center of that very maṇḍala is the “rasa of all glories.”

original: dpal he ru ka'i gtor ma'i cho ga la phyugs chen po zhes gang gsungs pa de la yang bag de la byas pa'i rang bzhin la tsandan dmar pos bskul ba'i mi'i gzugs brnyan yin par shes par shes par bya'i yan tu dag pa nyid ni ma yin no
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i gtor ma'i cho ga la phyugs chen po zhes gang gsungs pa de la yang bag de la byas pa'i rang bzhin la tsandan dmar pos bskul ba'i mi'i gzugs brnyan yin par shes par shes par bya'i yan tu dag pa nyid ni ma yin no
translated: In the rite of the sacrificial cake of Śrī Heruka, where it is said “a great animal,” there also the flesh is made of flour, and one should know that it is a human effigy smeared with red sandalwood.

original: // gang yang rta mchog gi gtor ma'i cho ga la sha smos pa de yang bag zan las byas pa'i khor nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: // gang yang rta mchog gi gtor ma'i cho ga la sha smos pa de yang bag zan las byas pa'i khor nar shes par bya'o //
translated: Also, in the rite of the sacrificial cake of the supreme horse, the flesh is said to be made of flour.

original: gang yang rgyal po'i zas sha dang chang dang ldan po rdo rje nyi ma'i gtor ma'i gsungs pa de yang bag phye'i zan las byas pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: gang yang rgyal po'i zas sha dang chang dang ldan po rdo rje nyi ma'i gtor ma'i gsungs pa de yang bag phye'i zan las byas pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o /
translated: Also, the food of the king, which is the sacrificial cake of meat and beer of Vajrasūrya, should be understood to be made only from flour.

original: la la na re de med na bya ba yin te /
analyzed: la la na re de med na bya ba yin te /
translated: Some say that if it is not available, it is to be done.

original: 'bras bu bcos ma la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bcos ma la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like a substitute for rice, etc.

original: mna' dang dam tshig ces pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mna' dang dam tshig ces pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The terms “vow” and “pledge” are synonyms.

original: sdom pa dang bde mchog ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: sdom pa dang bde mchog ni rnam grangs te /
translated: “Commitment” and “supreme bliss” are synonyms.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces gang gsungs pa de yang dam tshig ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces gang gsungs pa de yang dam tshig ste /
translated: That which is said to be “all buddhas” is also a pledge,

original: bde mchog gi ngo bo nyid dang / ae ma'o bde ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bde mchog gi ngo bo nyid dang / ae ma'o bde ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the essence of supreme bliss, and the essence of “Oh, bliss!”

original: sgrol ma zhes bya ba ni rab tu gsal bar rnams bar gzhag go //
analyzed: sgrol ma zhes bya ba ni rab tu gsal bar rnams bar gzhag go //
translated: “Tārā” is a clear expression.

original: shi shi ni yang srid pa ste /
analyzed: shi shi ni yang srid pa ste /
translated: “Śiśi” is rebirth.

original: phyag rgya de dag thams cad kyang dam tshig ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: phyag rgya de dag thams cad kyang dam tshig ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: All those seals are also called “pledges.”

original: gang gis she na 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis she na 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they are not to be transgressed.

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yin par bshad //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yin par bshad //
translated: It is explained as the application of the seal.

original: ces pa'o // phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: ces pa'o // phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yin par gsungs la /
translated: It is explained as the application of the seal.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba yang phyag rgya yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba yang phyag rgya yin par bshad do //
translated: And likewise, the application is explained as the seal.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor ba //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor ba //
translated: The glorious application of Vajrasattva

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is the supreme of all applications.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid du bsgom pa la sbyor bas ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid du bsgom pa la sbyor bas ste /
translated: It is the application of the meditation on the nature of all things.

original: de ni sbyor ba thams cad ces bshad do //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba thams cad ces bshad do //
translated: That is explained as all applications.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Now, etc. ”

original: gang gi phyir sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin zhing shin tu phul du byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje dga' ba sems kyi gsang ba'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin zhing shin tu phul du byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje dga' ba sems kyi gsang ba'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Because it is the source of all the various commitments, and it is the nature of the supreme bliss and mental joy, the secret of the mind, the nature of Vajra-joy.

original: de bas na sbyor ba thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called all applications.

original: de'i sbyor ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid de'i nye bar longs spyod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i khams gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid de'i nye bar longs spyod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i khams gsum mo //
translated: The enjoyment of that, which is the nature of all applications, is the three realms of the elements of form, etc.

original: de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to clarify that, he says:

original: de yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “That” and so forth.

original: gzugs ni ri mo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs ni ri mo zhes bshad do //
translated: Form is explained as painting.

original: sgra ni glu yin zhes bya ba ni glu blangs ba'o //
analyzed: sgra ni glu yin zhes bya ba ni glu blangs ba'o //
translated: Sound is singing, that is, chanting.

original: dri dang rab tu tshim par byed pa ni @109a * //
analyzed: dri dang rab tu tshim par byed pa ni @109a * //
translated: Smell and touch are the satisfaction of the mind.

original: rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rnam grangs so //
translated: These are synonyms.

original: ro'i ming ni ra sa ya na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ro'i ming ni ra sa ya na zhes bya'o //
translated: Taste is called rasa.

original: rig pa bde ba ni reg pa gang las bde ba skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa bde ba ni reg pa gang las bde ba skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: Awareness bliss is the contact from which bliss arises.

original: de ni bde ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: That is the bliss contact.

original: chos ni chos kyi skye mched de //
analyzed: chos ni chos kyi skye mched de //
translated: Dharma is the dharma base.

original: sbyor ba yin par bshad de //
analyzed: sbyor ba yin par bshad de //
translated: It is explained as the application.

original: de lta bu nyid ni sbyor ba thams cad kyi nye bar longs spyod pa thams cad kyis bdag gi lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas gang la ji ltar bde bar longs spyod pa de ni rang gi mchod pa'i dam tshig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ni sbyor ba thams cad kyi nye bar longs spyod pa thams cad kyis bdag gi lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas gang la ji ltar bde bar longs spyod pa de ni rang gi mchod pa'i dam tshig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that one’s own deity application is the commitment of one’s own worship, by which one enjoys whatever one likes, with all the enjoyments of all the applications.

original: rjes su sbyor bas mchod na ni //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su sbyor bas mchod na ni //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one worships with subsequent application,🔽one should understand that one’s own deity application is the commitment of one’s own worship, by which one enjoys whatever one likes, with all the enjoyments of all the applications.

original: ye shes sems dpa' yang gnyis su med par gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' yang gnyis su med par gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The gnosis being also becomes nondual, and so one enjoys form and so forth.

original: sbyor ba kun gyi bde ba ni gzugs pa la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa las bde ba gang skyes pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba kun gyi bde ba ni gzugs pa la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod pa las bde ba gang skyes pa de ni /
translated: The bliss of all unions is the bliss that arises from enjoying form and so forth.

original: bde ba chen po yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bde ba chen po yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: That is great bliss.

original: rang gi lha'i bdag nyid du bsgoms pa ni ye shes tsam la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i bdag nyid du bsgoms pa ni ye shes tsam la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Meditating on oneself as one’s deity is entering into meditative equipoise on mere gnosis.

original: de ni rnal 'byor zhes bshed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor zhes bshed pa yin no //
translated: That is explained as yoga.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang sbyor ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so //🔽lha mo thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba shin tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang sbyor ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so // lha mo thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba shin tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Union and meditative stabilization are synonyms.🔽The characteristic of the union of all goddesses is the gathering of all buddhas.

original: gang gi tshe thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba la sogs pas gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba la sogs pas gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: When one abides in the union of all and so forth, one is blessed by all buddhas.

original: de la sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor bzhes bya ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor bzhes bya ba 'thob bo //
translated: In this, one attains the state called “the union of all buddhas. ”

original: bsgrub pa de ni dga' bar spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa de ni dga' bar spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This practice is called “the practice of joy. ”

original: rjes su sbyor ba ni sngar bshad pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su sbyor ba ni sngar bshad pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice of the subsequent union is called “the practice of the qualities explained above. ”

original: lha mo rnams kyis skyes pa ltar byed pas dga' ba spyod pa ni slar rjes su bsgrub pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis skyes pa ltar byed pas dga' ba spyod pa ni slar rjes su bsgrub pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The practice of the joy of the practice of the goddesses is the practice of the subsequent union.

original: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang 'dus pa'i shin tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba gang yin pa de ni 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang 'dus pa'i shin tu sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba gang yin pa de ni 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bliss that is the characteristic of the union of the goddesses beginning with Sukloṣṇīṣa is called “the union. ”

original: rgyun la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the entry into the stream.

original: de ni sbyor ba kun la mos pa ste /
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba kun la mos pa ste /
translated: This is the devotion to all the practices.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnga' ni bde ba ni yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnga' ni bde ba ni yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The power of all the buddhas is bliss.

original: dngos grub thams cad ldang ba'i sgra'i tshig can te //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ldang ba'i sgra'i tshig can te //
translated: It is the word of the sound of the arising of all powers.

original: thams cad du grub pa gang yin pa de ni ldang ba kun du 'gro ba dngos grub chen po ste /
analyzed: thams cad du grub pa gang yin pa de ni ldang ba kun du 'gro ba dngos grub chen po ste /
translated: That which is accomplished in all ways is the universal arising, the great power.

original: ldang ba chen po'o //
analyzed: ldang ba chen po'o //
translated: It is the great arising.

original: dngos grub chen po @109b kun gyi mchog / rdo rje 'chang ba chen po nyid dang dbang phyug chen po bla na med pa ni /
analyzed: dngos grub chen po @109b kun gyi mchog / rdo rje 'chang ba chen po nyid dang dbang phyug chen po bla na med pa ni /
translated: The supreme of all great powers is the state of Great Vajradhara, the unsurpassed sovereignty.

original: bla na med pa'i dbang phyug yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i dbang phyug yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained as the unsurpassed sovereignty.🔽Since it is free from all obscurations of the three realms, it is the supreme of all great powers, the state of Great Vajradhara, the unsurpassed bliss.

original: khams gsum pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bas rang gi rgyud dang dngos grub chen po thams cad kyi mchog dbang phyug chen por gyur pas bla na med pa'i bde ba ni dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog dbang phyug chen po'i bde ba'i mchog ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bas rang gi rgyud dang dngos grub chen po thams cad kyi mchog dbang phyug chen por gyur pas bla na med pa'i bde ba ni dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog dbang phyug chen po'i bde ba'i mchog ste /
translated: That is the supreme bliss of the great sovereignty, the supreme of all great powers.

original: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba /
translated: It is explained as the union of all buddhas,

original: sbyor ba'i dbang phyug chen po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbang phyug chen po zhes bshad do //
translated: the great lord of union.

original: me tog ni khrag ces bshad do //
analyzed: me tog ni khrag ces bshad do //
translated: Flower is explained as blood.

original: bdug pa ni mdangs kyi tshig can no //
analyzed: bdug pa ni mdangs kyi tshig can no //
translated: Incense is the word for radiance.

original: mar me ni sha chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mar me ni sha chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The lamp is called “great flesh.”

original: dri dang spos thams cad kyi rnam grangs ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dri dang spos thams cad kyi rnam grangs ni bshad zin to //
translated: The synonyms of all smells and incense have been explained.

original: 'o mar gyur pa las byung ba ni phrum ste /
analyzed: 'o mar gyur pa las byung ba ni phrum ste /
translated: That which arises from milk is curds.

original: de ni zla ba nya ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zla ba nya ma zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “the full moon.”

original: sha'i ming ni sman zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sha'i ming ni sman zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of flesh is “medicine.”

original: chang ni bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chang ni bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
translated: Wine is called “elixir.”

original: zas ni tshe zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zas ni tshe zhes bya'o //
translated: Food is called “life.”

original: sha dang chang du ldan pa'i bza' ba sna tshogs ni dga' ba'i longs spyod skal ba bzang po'i tshe'i dam pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sha dang chang du ldan pa'i bza' ba sna tshogs ni dga' ba'i longs spyod skal ba bzang po'i tshe'i dam pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The various foods that are endowed with flesh and wine are the supreme life of the good fortune of the enjoyment of pleasure.

original: aa mra'i 'bras bu smin pa la sogs pa ni bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: aa mra'i 'bras bu smin pa la sogs pa ni bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the ripe mango fruit, etc., are the fruit of nectar.

original: sgrol ba ni bde ba myang ba dang / bde bas rab tu rmongs pa yin no zhes bshad do//
analyzed: sgrol ba ni bde ba myang ba dang / bde bas rab tu rmongs pa yin no zhes bshad do//
translated: It is explained that liberation is the experience of bliss and the delusion of bliss.

original: sbyor ba dang ting nge 'dzin rnam grangs te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ting nge 'dzin rnam grangs te /
translated: Union and meditative concentration are synonyms.

original: gang lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i lha mo'i sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: gang lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par 'dus pa'i lha mo'i sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of the union of all goddesses and the goddess of perfect union is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa zhes bshad do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa zhes bshad do /
translated: It is explained that the union of all Buddhas is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Vajrasattva.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.

original: aa mra dang smin pa la sogs pa ming gi rnam grags so //🔽dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba'i glu dang / sil snyan dang / gar byed pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par sprul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa mra dang smin pa la sogs pa ming gi rnam grags so // dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba'i glu dang / sil snyan dang / gar byed pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par sprul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i sil snyan dang / glu dang / gar zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi glu ste /🔽de ni shin tu rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i sil snyan dang / glu dang / gar zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi glu ste / de ni shin tu rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.

original: dur khrod kyi glu dang sil snyan dang gar byed pa ni dpal he ru ka'i yin te /🔽de ni rab tu sprul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi glu dang sil snyan dang gar byed pa ni dpal he ru ka'i yin te / de ni rab tu sprul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.

original: chags pa dang bcas pa'i glu dang / sil snyan dang / gar ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi ste /🔽de yang dpal rnam par srul pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa'i glu dang / sil snyan dang / gar ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi ste /🔽de yang dpal rnam par srul pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.🔽The song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka is the song, music, and dance of the glorious Heruka.

original: mi'i dbang po'i glu dang / sil snyan dang / gang ni rdo rje nyi ma dang 'grel ba @110a * //
analyzed: mi'i dbang po'i glu dang / sil snyan dang / gang ni rdo rje nyi ma dang 'grel ba @110a * //
translated: The song of the lord of men, and the cymbals, and the dance, are the sun and the vajra.

original: ste ; de yang shin tu rnam par sprul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ste ; de yang shin tu rnam par sprul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called the “complete emanation.”

original: rab tu dga' ba'i glu dang / sil snyan dang gar ni rta mchog dang 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i glu dang / sil snyan dang gar ni rta mchog dang 'brel ba ste /
translated: The song, cymbals, and dance of supreme joy are connected with the supreme horse.

original: de ni rta mchog rna par sprul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rta mchog rna par sprul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called the “complete emanation of the supreme horse.”

original: bde zhes gang gsungs pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bde zhes gang gsungs pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate what was said about “bliss,”

original: de zhes bya ba la mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “that” and so on.

original: kun du sna tshogs pa'i phyag phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs pa'i phyag phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: The universal variety of hands is the great seal of Vajrasattva.

analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
