translated: it is said, “attachment,” etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bzlas pa ni yi ge h'um ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bzlas pa ni yi ge h'um ste /
translated: The recitation of Vajrasattva is the syllable HŪM.

original: de ni 'di yin te rjes su chags par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di yin te rjes su chags par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning: “One should be passionately attached to it.”

original: khyed kyi bdag nyid du mngon du byas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi bdag nyid du mngon du byas so zhes pa'o //
translated: It means “I have manifested myself in your nature.”

original: yi ge aom ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis bzlas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge aom ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis bzlas par bya ba ste /
translated: The recitation of Vairocana is the syllable OṀ.

original: 'di'i don rjes su chud par bya'o zhes pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di'i don rjes su chud par bya'o zhes pa ste ;
translated: This is the meaning: “One should penetrate it.”

original: khyed kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub mngon du bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub mngon du bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It means “I have manifested enlightenment in your nature.”

original: dpal he ru ka'i bzlas pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje ha ha bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i bzlas pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje ha ha bzhad pa'o //
translated: The recitation of Śrī Heruka is the previously explained vajra laughter HA HA.

original: de'i rjes su sbyor ba bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su sbyor ba bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning: “One should practice it.”

original: khyed kyi bdag nyid chen po gcig pur gyur pa bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi bdag nyid chen po gcig pur gyur pa bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It means “You should generate yourself as the sole great being.”

original: padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi bzlas pa ni yi ge aom ste /
analyzed: padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi bzlas pa ni yi ge aom ste /
translated: The recitation of Padmanartteśvara is the syllable AḤ.

original: de'i don rjes su sbyor bar bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don rjes su sbyor bar bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning: “One should practice it.”

original: khyed kyi bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byas pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byas pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Your nature is the direct realization of the pure reality.

original: rdo rje ma'i bzlas pa'i yi ge hi ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ma'i bzlas pa'i yi ge hi ste /
translated: The syllable hi of the Vajrī recitation

original: de'i don la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes pa ste /🔽khyed @112a * //
analyzed: de'i don la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o zhes pa ste / khyed @112a * //
translated: means that one should rejoice in its meaning.

original: kyi bla na med pa'i don gyi phun sum tshogs pa las tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kyi bla na med pa'i don gyi phun sum tshogs pa las tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: You should enter into the state of supreme joy from the abundance of the unsurpassed meaning.

original: rta mchog gi bzlas pa ni yi ge h'um la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rta mchog gi bzlas pa ni yi ge h'um la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The recitation of the Supreme Horse is any of the syllables such as hūṃ.

original: de'i rjes su bstan par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bstan par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: One should teach its meaning after that.

original: khyod dang gnyis su med par gyur pas na lha dang 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyod dang gnyis su med par gyur pas na lha dang 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: Since one becomes nondual with you, one becomes mixed with the deity.

original: dngos grub pa la sogs pa grub pa dang ma grub pa la sogs pa shes par bya ba'i don du rnam par shes pa'i phyag rgya nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos grub pa la sogs pa grub pa dang ma grub pa la sogs pa shes par bya ba'i don du rnam par shes pa'i phyag rgya nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge consort for the sake of knowing the accomplishments and nonaccomplishments of powers, and so on, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dpal sbyor ba //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dpal sbyor ba //
translated: the glorious union with Vajrasattva,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba ni dang po yi ge h'um zhes rdo rje sems dpa' rnams par bsams la /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba ni dang po yi ge h'um zhes rdo rje sems dpa' rnams par bsams la /
translated: The yoga of glorious Vajrasattva is as follows: First, one should visualize the syllable hūṃ and Vajrasattva.

original: phyi rol du mchod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byas te /
analyzed: phyi rol du mchod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byas te /
translated: Then, one should perform the outer activities of worship and so forth.

original: khye'u 'am bu mo la phyag rgya chen pos spyan drang ba la sogs pa'i rim pa byas la rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: khye'u 'am bu mo la phyag rgya chen pos spyan drang ba la sogs pa'i rim pa byas la rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Then, one should invite the boy or girl with the great seal and so forth, and bless them as Vajrasattva.

original: de'i ming du rdo rje h'um las byung ba rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: de'i ming du rdo rje h'um las byung ba rnam par bsams la /
translated: One should visualize their name as arisen from the vajra hūṃ.

original: bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
analyzed: bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
translated: One should perform the recitation one hundred and eight times.

original: chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste //
analyzed: chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste //
translated: The truth is that all phenomena are like reflections,

original: gdod nas dag cing dri ma med //
analyzed: gdod nas dag cing dri ma med //
translated: primordially pure and stainless.

original: ces bya ba'i bden pa gang yin pa des na /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bden pa gang yin pa des na /
translated: By that truth,🔽may they see without error.

original: phyin ci ma log par mthong bar gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs sngon du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par mthong bar gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs sngon du bya ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, one should explain the prior consecration of the truth.

original: de bzhin du rna ba yang thams cad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba yang thams cad ces bya ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the ear is all.

original: bden pa gang gis chos rnams sgra brnyan lta bu yin pa'i bden pa des phyin ci ma log par thos par gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs byas la /
analyzed: bden pa gang gis chos rnams sgra brnyan lta bu yin pa'i bden pa des phyin ci ma log par thos par gyur cig ces bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs byas la /
translated: By the power of the truth of the reality of phenomena as like an echo, may I hear correctly.

original: sgra rnams dang por bsgo'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams dang por bsgo'o //
translated: One should first meditate on sounds.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa ni /
translated: Similarly, one who is a yogin of Vairochana

original: las la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: las la sogs pa la'o //
translated: should do so with regard to karma and so forth.

original: de bzhin du dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor ba ni /
translated: Similarly, one who is a yogin of glorious Heruka

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad la'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad la'o //
translated: should do so with regard to all desirable qualities such as form and so forth.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor pa ni /
translated: Similarly, one who is a yogin of Lokeśvara

original: sna tshogs padma kha 'byed pa'i tshul gyis padma de nyid la'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma kha 'byed pa'i tshul gyis padma de nyid la'o //
translated: should do so with regard to that very lotus in the manner of opening a variegated lotus.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje nyi ma'i rnal 'byor pa ni me tog la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje nyi ma'i rnal 'byor pa ni me tog la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Similarly, one who is a yogin of Vajrasūrya should do so with regard to flowers and so forth.

original: de bzhin du rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pa ni reg pa dang ma reg pas rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa dang / shing la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pa ni reg pa dang ma reg pas rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa dang / shing la sogs pa la ste /
translated: Similarly, one who is a yogin of Hayagrīva should do so with regard to contact and non-contact, with regard to Vajrarāja and so forth, and with regard to trees and so forth.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa la reg pa dang ma reg pa ni lag pa rig pa dang / @112b ma rig pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa la reg pa dang ma reg pa ni lag pa rig pa dang / @112b ma rig pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the contact or non-contact of the vajra, etc. is due to the awareness or non-awareness of the hand.

original: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad du yang dang po'i sbyor ba yang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad du yang dang po'i sbyor ba yang thun mong yin no //
translated: And in all cases, such as the proper and improper, the first application is common.

original: srung ba'i phyag rgya nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor ba //
analyzed: srung ba'i phyag rgya nye bar bstan pa'i phyir / rdo rje sems dpa' dpal sbyor ba //
translated: In order to demonstrate the protection seal,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The glorious Vajrasattva union,” and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod la sogs pa'i thal ba la yi ge h'um gis rdo rje byas la des thig ler byas pas bdag dang gzhan bsrung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod la sogs pa'i thal ba la yi ge h'um gis rdo rje byas la des thig ler byas pas bdag dang gzhan bsrung ngo //
translated: The practitioner of the Vajrasattva yoga, having made a vajra with the syllable HŪṀ on charnel ground ash, etc., should protect self and other by making a drop with it.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu la sogs pas gtor ma la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu la sogs pas gtor ma la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, with water flowing into the ocean, etc., the bali offering, etc. are as before.

original: mi'i thod pa'i nang du bskyed pa'i yungs kar la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mi'i thod pa'i nang du bskyed pa'i yungs kar la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Also, mustard seed, etc. generated in a human skull cup are the same.

original: de bzhin du ma mchu sos mnan nas g-yon du 'bying bas 'dud la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma mchu sos mnan nas g-yon du 'bying bas 'dud la /
translated: Likewise, with the lips pressed together, one should bow to the left,

original: dril bu bzung la g-yas pas rdo rje bzung ste /
analyzed: dril bu bzung la g-yas pas rdo rje bzung ste /
translated: holding the bell and holding the vajra in the right hand.

original: 'jig pas phyogs bcing ba la sogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pas phyogs bcing ba la sogs par bya'o //
translated: One should do the binding of the directions, etc., with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: lha mo kun gyi bde ba ni mchog la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha mo kun gyi bde ba ni mchog la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bliss of all goddesses is the supreme, etc.

original: de rnams sam gzhan dag gnyis su med par gyur pas bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams sam gzhan dag gnyis su med par gyur pas bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should complete the consecration of oneself, etc., by becoming nondual with them or others.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas ni lag pa g-yas pa'i rdo rje mtshams bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas ni lag pa g-yas pa'i rdo rje mtshams bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The practitioner of Vairocana should bind the vajra of the right hand.

original: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor bas ni de'i glu dang / gar gyi sbyor bas thams cad bsrungs na rims la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor bas ni de'i glu dang / gar gyi sbyor bas thams cad bsrungs na rims la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The practitioner of Śrī Heruka should protect everything with the application of his song and dance. All contagious diseases, etc., will be destroyed.

original: padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor pas /
translated: The practitioner of Padmanarteśvara

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la mos pas sna tshogs padma kha 'byed pas sgrib pa dang bral ba la sogs pa rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la mos pas sna tshogs padma kha 'byed pas sgrib pa dang bral ba la sogs pa rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: By being devoted to the naturally pure, one should complete the opening of the lotus of various kinds, the freedom from obscurations, and so forth.

original: rdo rje nyi ma'i rnal 'byor pas ni /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'i rnal 'byor pas ni /
translated: The practitioner of the Vajra Sun

original: rang gi lus rdo rje 'bar bar bsgrub pas bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus rdo rje 'bar bar bsgrub pas bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: should protect by accomplishing one’s body as the blazing vajra.

original: dpal rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pas ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings lo go cha gyon pa nas thal mo brdabs du rdzogs par byas pas bdag nyid bsrung ngo //
analyzed: dpal rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pas ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings lo go cha gyon pa nas thal mo brdabs du rdzogs par byas pas bdag nyid bsrung ngo //
translated: The practitioner of the glorious Supreme Horse should protect oneself by making the two vajra fists, putting on the armor, and so forth, up to the clapping of the hands.

original: gzhan ni bdag gi nang du bcug la go cha la sogs pas bsrung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag gi nang du bcug la go cha la sogs pas bsrung ngo //
translated: The other should be placed inside oneself and protected by the armor and so forth.

original: sbyor ba thams cad la yang rang gi snying po rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la yang rang gi snying po rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: In all the yogas, one should recite one’s essence mantra.

original: rims la sogs pa gnod pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du che'i rig byed shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rims la sogs pa gnod pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du che'i rig byed shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the Vedas for the purpose of freedom from the harm of fever and so forth,

original: chos sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i @113a * //
analyzed: chos sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i @113a * //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the Dharma-thought, and so on.🔽The practitioner of the glorious Vajrasattva

original: rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas /
translated: should protect by the yoga of the vajra fist.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas mig phye la zhi ba'i lta bas bltas la /🔽rims la sogs pas btab pa la spyi bo nas rkang par thug pa la bya bas shing /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas mig phye la zhi ba'i lta bas bltas la / rims la sogs pas btab pa la spyi bo nas rkang par thug pa la bya bas shing /
translated: Having formed the two vajra fists, one should open the eyes and look with a peaceful gaze.

original: bcom ldan 'das zla ba'i mdog lta bus bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la gang par bsam mo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zla ba'i mdog lta bus bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la gang par bsam mo //
translated: For one who is afflicted by fever, etc., one should press from the head to the feet, and imagine that the Blessed One, the color of the moon, fills the body of the one to be accomplished.

original: grang ba'i rims la ni sku mdog dmar po bsams te /
analyzed: grang ba'i rims la ni sku mdog dmar po bsams te /
translated: For one afflicted by cold fever, one should imagine the body to be red in color.

original: des na thams cad sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thams cad sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all [ailments] will be removed.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la /
translated: Likewise, having formed the two vajra fists,

original: mthe'u chung lcags kyu bcings pas sbyor te /
analyzed: mthe'u chung lcags kyu bcings pas sbyor te /
translated: one should join the hooks of the two little fingers,

original: mdzub mo gnyis sbyar la rims la sogs pa nang du bsams la btsir bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis sbyar la rims la sogs pa nang du bsams la btsir bar bya'o //
translated: and having joined the two index fingers, one should imagine the fever, etc., inside and press.

original: de nyid bde blag gi sbyor bas yongs su bsgyur te /
analyzed: de nyid bde blag gi sbyor bas yongs su bsgyur te /
translated: Having transformed that very [mudra] by the yoga of ease,

original: 'phral la gzhag na des sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phral la gzhag na des sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if one places it on the spot, it will remove suffering, etc.

original: mdzub mo phan tshun mngon phyogs pa //
analyzed: mdzub mo phan tshun mngon phyogs pa //
translated: The two index fingers face each other.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo phan tshun sbyar te bzung la zug rdu 'byin pa ltar byas na de phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo phan tshun sbyar te bzung la zug rdu 'byin pa ltar byas na de phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the gesture of the two index fingers crossed and held together, like a splinter extractor; it removes splinters.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba 'di nyid la sogs pas btsir ba'i tshul du byas na nad thams cad sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba 'di nyid la sogs pas btsir ba'i tshul du byas na nad thams cad sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, by pressing with this very gesture and so forth, all diseases are removed.

original: grub pa'i spyan gyis byas pa ni long bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i spyan gyis byas pa ni long bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The one made by the eye of accomplishment will see the blind.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la khar bcug nas /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la khar bcug nas /
translated: Seizing with the vajra fist, one should insert it into the mouth,

original: 'jug pa'i tshul du byas na sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul du byas na sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and by the method of entering, it will be removed.

original: rims la sogs pa bsal ba yang rim pa de nyid do //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa bsal ba yang rim pa de nyid do //
translated: The removal of fever and so forth is just that process.

original: mang la na gnas pa la ni lha'i gzugs su bsams la /
analyzed: mang la na gnas pa la ni lha'i gzugs su bsams la /
translated: For one afflicted with many diseases, one should imagine the form of the deity,

original: rnam par bzlas pa byas nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba la mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /
analyzed: rnam par bzlas pa byas nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro // rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba la mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste /
translated: and having recited the mantra, one will be cured.🔽The supreme retention is the vajra palms joined, with the two index fingers bent,

original: mthe bong gnyis bsnyams te rtse mog gnyis nang du bcug la sbyar ba ni bzung ba'i mchog ste sems dpa'i gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis bsnyams te rtse mog gnyis nang du bcug la sbyar ba ni bzung ba'i mchog ste sems dpa'i gtsug tor ro //
translated: the two thumbs even, and the two tips joined inside.

original: gnyis su byas nas g-yas pa'i sems dpa'i gtsug gtor byis pa'i mgor bzhag na nad med pa dang / 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing mi zad pa'i bde ba thob par byed do ;
analyzed: gnyis su byas nas g-yas pa'i sems dpa'i gtsug gtor byis pa'i mgor bzhag na nad med pa dang / 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing mi zad pa'i bde ba thob par byed do ;
translated: Having made a pair, if one places the crown of the Bodhisattva on the right on the head of the child, he will be free from disease and will live, and will obtain inexhaustible bliss.

original: / lag pa g-yas pa klu'i gdengs ka lta bur byas nas /
analyzed: / lag pa g-yas pa klu'i gdengs ka lta bur byas nas /
translated: Having made the right hand like the hood of a nāga,

original: de las byung ba bsgrub par bya la rnam par gzhug pas 'bar bas bltas na /
analyzed: de las byung ba bsgrub par bya la rnam par gzhug pas 'bar bas bltas na /
translated: one should visualize the accomplishment that arises from that.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang gis thams cad za ba la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang gis thams cad za ba la sogs pa byed do //
translated: By looking with the blazing, one should do all things such as eating, etc.,🔽by the power of the desired object.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas /
translated: The practitioner of Vairocana,

original: g-yas pa'i mthe @113b bong dang / gung mo gnyis kyis g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi gung mo dang mthe bong la reg pas de las byung ba rdo rje 'bar ba rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das gdon rnams 'jigs par blta'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i mthe @113b bong dang / gung mo gnyis kyis g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi gung mo dang mthe bong la reg pas de las byung ba rdo rje 'bar ba rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das gdon rnams 'jigs par blta'o //
translated: having touched the right thumb and ring finger with the left fist’s ring finger and thumb, should look at the blazing vajras that arise from that, and the Blessed One will frighten the grahas.

original: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor pas gdug pas bsgrub par byas la mngon du phyogs te /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor pas gdug pas bsgrub par byas la mngon du phyogs te /
translated: The practitioner of Śrī Heruka, having accomplished the wicked one, should look at him directly.

original: rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la de las rdo rje 'bar ba 'byung bar mos pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i phyag rgyas gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la de las rdo rje 'bar ba 'byung bar mos pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i phyag rgyas gsal bar bya'o //
translated: Having bound the vajra seal, one should visualize the blazing vajra seal of the dakinis.

original: rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pas rta thams cad bzhon par bya'o //
analyzed: rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pas rta thams cad bzhon par bya'o //
translated: The yogin of Hayagriva should mount all horses.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas g-yas dang g-yon du yi ge h'um las de'i sku bsams la rnam par bzlas pa byas na srog pa la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas g-yas dang g-yon du yi ge h'um las de'i sku bsams la rnam par bzlas pa byas na srog pa la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogin of Vajrasattva should visualize the form of Vajrasattva to the right and left, and if he recites the mantra, his life and so forth will increase.

original: de bzhin dus bon la sogs pa la yang de'i skur bskyed la rmod zhing bskyed pa byas na thams cad 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin dus bon la sogs pa la yang de'i skur bskyed la rmod zhing bskyed pa byas na thams cad 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if one generates the form of Vajrasattva in the life-force and so forth, and recites the mantra, all will be prosperous.

original: dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa la sogs pa dang rab tu tu ldan pa na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa la sogs pa dang rab tu tu ldan pa na /
translated: When one is endowed with the mandala, siddhi, and so forth,

original: gal te gzhan gyi dmig tshogs la sogs pa 'jigs pa 'byung ba yang srid pas de bzlog pa'i don dgra cha'i phyag rgya shes par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dmig tshogs la sogs pa 'jigs pa 'byung ba yang srid pas de bzlog pa'i don dgra cha'i phyag rgya shes par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: if the fear of others' armies and so forth should arise, in order to avert that, the knowledge of the seal of the enemy's weapon is taught.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The thrown by a machine and so on are as follows.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa ni mda' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa ni mda' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thrown by a machine are arrows and so on.

original: ma 'phangs pa ni ral gri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'phangs pa ni ral gri la sogs pa'o //
translated: The not thrown are swords and so on.

original: lag pas 'phangs pa ni 'khor lo sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lag pas 'phangs pa ni 'khor lo sogs pa'o //
translated: The thrown by hand are discuses and so on.

original: 'phangs nas slar bzung ba ni zhags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phangs nas slar bzung ba ni zhags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thrown and then held are lassos and so on.

original: stobs su 'gyed pa ni nus dang ldan dang rol pa dang langs pa dang dpa' ba dang / lag stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs su 'gyed pa ni nus dang ldan dang rol pa dang langs pa dang dpa' ba dang / lag stobs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thrown by force are those with power, those with play, those with rise, those with heroism, those with hand strength, and so on.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the thrown by a machine,

original: dbyibs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbyibs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said shape, and so on.

original: de rnams kyang rim bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rim bzhin du ston te /
translated: Those are taught in order.

original: de la dbyi bas ni sa ga'i 'dug stangs dang / zlum po'i 'dug stangs dang / g-yas brkyang ba ste rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la dbyi bas ni sa ga'i 'dug stangs dang / zlum po'i 'dug stangs dang / g-yas brkyang ba ste rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Therein, the five are the sitting posture of the earth, the sitting posture of the circle, and the right leg extended.

original: de yang gang 'di lhan cig lags par ni mthe bong rting pa sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: de yang gang 'di lhan cig lags par ni mthe bong rting pa sbyar ba ni /
translated: And that is this: The heel of the thumb is joined.

original: mnyam por 'dug pa'i dbyi bas bzhin shes //
analyzed: mnyam por 'dug pa'i dbyi bas bzhin shes //
translated: It is known as the sitting posture of the equal.

original: de nyid shes pa rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa rnams kyis bshad //
translated: This is explained by those who know reality.

original: rkang pa'i sor mo phyir bstan te //
analyzed: rkang pa'i sor mo phyir bstan te //
translated: The toes are turned outward,🔽the two thighs are erect and unshaking,🔽the twenty-six joints are turned inward,

original: brla gnyis mi skyod 'greng ba dag / tshur ni sor tshigs nyi shu drug / sa ga'i 'dug stangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis mi skyod 'greng ba dag / tshur ni sor tshigs nyi shu drug / sa ga'i 'dug stangs zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the “sitting posture of the earth.”

original: ngang pa'i sgra ltar mnyam @114a * //🔽bya zhing / pus mo gnyis dag bkug nas ni //
analyzed: ngang pa'i sgra ltar mnyam @114a * // bya zhing / pus mo gnyis dag bkug nas ni //
translated: The sound is like that of a goose,🔽the two knees are bent,

original: lag gnyis nang du 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: lag gnyis nang du 'jug pa ni //
translated: and the two hands are placed inside,

original: zlum po'i 'dug stangs yin par grangs //
analyzed: zlum po'i 'dug stangs yin par grangs //
translated: this is known as the “round sitting posture.”

original: g-yon pa gzhol zhing bkug nas ni //🔽g-yas pa'i phus mo brlar brkyang nas //
analyzed: g-yon pa gzhol zhing bkug nas ni // g-yas pa'i phus mo brlar brkyang nas //
translated: The left [foot] is bent and turned to the side,🔽the right knee is extended to the thigh,🔽placed in line with the left,

original: g-yon gyi thad kar bzhag pa dang / brla dang pus mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi thad kar bzhag pa dang / brla dang pus mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: the thigh and knee are joined.

original: rgyar ni mtho lnga brkyang pa ni //
analyzed: rgyar ni mtho lnga brkyang pa ni //
translated: The width is extended five cubits,

original: g-yas brkyang par ni grags pa yin //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang par ni grags pa yin //
translated: this is known as the “right-legged posture.”

original: de las bzlog par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: de las bzlog par gyur pa ni //
translated: The opposite of that

original: g-yon pa brkyang bar shes par bya //
analyzed: g-yon pa brkyang bar shes par bya //
translated: is known as the “left-legged posture.”

original: mi lhod pa dang sran tshugs dang // mnyen zhing yan lag bstan pa dang // rgya chen 'greng zhing rnam par dag /
analyzed: mi lhod pa dang sran tshugs dang // mnyen zhing yan lag bstan pa dang // rgya chen 'greng zhing rnam par dag /
translated: vast, erect, and pure.

original: ces bya ba ni bde blag can gyis sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde blag can gyis sbyar ba'o //
translated: This is the composition of the easy one.

original: rang gi snying gar 'dren tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun du sbyor zhing 'dren myur ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar 'dren tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun du sbyor zhing 'dren myur ba'o //
translated: The way of drawing to one's heart and so forth is the union and drawing.

original: lag pa g-yon pa legs bsrang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'greng ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa legs bsrang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'greng ba'o //
translated: Straightening the left arm and so forth is the erect one.

original: rna drung bar du bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rna drung bar du bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The action in the space between the ears and so forth is the holding one.

original: yi ge aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni ji srid bar du bkang ba yin gyi brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni ji srid bar du bkang ba yin gyi brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The letter Om and so forth are as long as one can hold one's breath, but not to be spoken.

original: dus de srid kyi bar du bzang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dus de srid kyi bar du bzang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: For that long it is good means for that long.

original: ji ltar rim par drangs nas zhes dbye ba la sogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rim par drangs nas zhes dbye ba la sogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The drawing in stages and so forth is the need.

original: chang pas bzhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: chang pas bzhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phen pa'o //
translated: The accepting with the mouth and so forth is the throwing.

original: gru bzhi pa la zhes pa ni de'i mdun du drangs pa'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la zhes pa ni de'i mdun du drangs pa'o //
translated: The in the square is the drawing in front of that.

original: dro ba dang zhes pa ni g-yon phyogs su'o //
analyzed: dro ba dang zhes pa ni g-yon phyogs su'o //
translated: “Warm” is on the left side.

original: kun nas bskor bar bya ba ni rgyab tu bzlog pa'o //🔽gang phyogs na ni mda' skor nas //
analyzed: kun nas bskor bar bya ba ni rgyab tu bzlog pa'o // gang phyogs na ni mda' skor nas //
translated: “Surrounding” is behind.

original: zhes bya ba ni g-yas la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni g-yas la gnas pa'o //
translated: “In which direction” is to the right.

original: smad de zhes bya ba ni 'ben 'og tu btsugs pa'o //
analyzed: smad de zhes bya ba ni 'ben 'og tu btsugs pa'o //
translated: “Below” is the target set below.

original: bstod pa dang ni zhes bya ba ni steng du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa dang ni zhes bya ba ni steng du bzhag pa'o //
translated: “Praise” is set above.

original: rkang pas mnan pa ni rkang pa g-yas kyis g-yon mnan pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pas mnan pa ni rkang pa g-yas kyis g-yon mnan pa'o //
translated: “Stomping” is the right foot on the left.

original: mnan pa de yang rim bzhin du me'i phyogs nas 'ben la 'bigs pa'o //
analyzed: mnan pa de yang rim bzhin du me'i phyogs nas 'ben la 'bigs pa'o //
translated: That stomping is in the direction of fire, piercing the target.

original: mig pa'i rkang ba'i rting pa ste //
analyzed: mig pa'i rkang ba'i rting pa ste //
translated: The heel of the foot🔽is in the direction of wind, piercing the target.

original: des de bzhin du mnan nas bden bral dang / rlung gi phyogs kyi 'ben la 'bigs pa bcu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: des de bzhin du mnan nas bden bral dang / rlung gi phyogs kyi 'ben la 'bigs pa bcu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: That is the ten-seal mudrā.

original: rab tu 'phangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi 'phangs pa ston to //
analyzed: rab tu 'phangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi 'phangs pa ston to //
translated: “Well-thrown” and so on shows the four throws.

original: nyam nga lag dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba lag pas 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: nyam nga lag dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba lag pas 'phen pa'o //
translated: “Dangerously” and so on shows the throw with the hand.

original: thams cad 'debs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'ben thabs lar bzung ba ston to //
analyzed: thams cad 'debs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'ben thabs lar bzung ba ston to //
translated: The phrase all-seizing and so forth teaches the target-seizing.🔽 The wise perform the wheel-throwing and so forth with the conventions of action and so forth.🔽 The phrase the wheel-throwing is the wheel-throwing of the wheel-weapon.

original: @114b 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa yang bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis de la mkhas rnams byed do //
analyzed: @114b 'khrul 'khor gyis 'phangs pa yang bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis de la mkhas rnams byed do //
translated: The phrase the target-seizing is the target-seizing of the target-weapon.🔽 The phrase the arrow-shooting is the arrow-shooting of the arrow-weapon.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis gzhag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis gzhag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the spear-throwing is the spear-throwing of the spear-weapon.🔽 The phrase the sword-striking is the sword-striking of the sword-weapon.🔽 The phrase the axe-chopping is the axe-chopping of the axe-weapon.🔽 The phrase the lasso-throwing is the lasso-throwing of the lasso-weapon.🔽 The phrase the hook-grasping is the hook-grasping of the hook-weapon.🔽 The phrase the chain-binding is the chain-binding of the chain-weapon.🔽 The phrase the bell-ringing is the bell-ringing of the bell-weapon.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lha'i sbyor ba byin gyis brlab pa'i las thams cad shes pa'i phyag rgya bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lha'i sbyor ba byin gyis brlab pa'i las thams cad shes pa'i phyag rgya bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase the vajra-striking is the vajra-striking of the vajra-weapon.

original: srin lag gnyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽srin lag gnyis kyi nang du ni //
analyzed: srin lag gnyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / srin lag gnyis kyi nang du ni //
translated: The phrase the wheel-throwing and so forth are the wheel-throwing and so forth of the wheel-weapon and so forth.🔽 The phrase the target-seizing and so forth are the target-seizing and so forth of the target-weapon and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni srin lag gi rtsa ba'i nang du'o //🔽mthe bong legs par gzhug par bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srin lag gi rtsa ba'i nang du'o // mthe bong legs par gzhug par bya //
translated: The phrase the arrow-shooting and so forth are the arrow-shooting and so forth of the arrow-weapon and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthe bong gi rtse mo dang sbyar ro //🔽mdzub mo legs par gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthe bong gi rtse mo dang sbyar ro // mdzub mo legs par gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The phrase the spear-throwing and so forth are the spear-throwing and so forth of the spear-weapon and so forth.🔽 The phrase the sword-striking and so forth are the sword-striking and so forth of the sword-weapon and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo'i rtse mo bkug la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo'i rtse mo bkug la /
translated: The phrase the axe-chopping and so forth are the axe-chopping and so forth of the axe-weapon and so forth.🔽 The phrase the lasso-throwing and so forth are the lasso-throwing and

original: mthe bo'i ngos kyis mnan pa ste //
analyzed: mthe bo'i ngos kyis mnan pa ste //
translated: The index finger is bent at the tip,

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa'i las kyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa'i las kyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: This is the action seal of the Bhagavat Vajrasattva together with his retinue.

original: bdag gi mthe bong nang du gzhug / ces bya ba ni mthe bong nang nas chos gos 'dzin pa'i tshul du bzhag pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mthe bong nang du gzhug / ces bya ba ni mthe bong nang nas chos gos 'dzin pa'i tshul du bzhag pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The line one should insert the thumb inside means that one should place the thumb inside, as if holding a Dharma robe. This is the Bhagavat Vairocana together with his retinue.

original: dpal he ru ka 'khor dang bcas pa'i khu tshur bcangs pa las mthe chung brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka 'khor dang bcas pa'i khu tshur bcangs pa las mthe chung brkyang ba'o //
translated: The glorious Heruka together with his retinue is the vajra fist with the little finger extended.

original: padma'i khu tshur ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i khu tshur ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The lotus fist is Padmanateśvara together with his retinue.

original: rdo rje khu tshur rin chen mchog / ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rin po che'i khu tshur te /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur rin chen mchog / ces bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rin po che'i khu tshur te /
translated: The line the vajra fist is the supreme jewel refers to the previously explained jewel fist.

original: rdo rje nyi ma'i 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'i 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is Vajrasūrya together with his retinue.

original: rdo rje khu tshur bcings pa la mthe bong nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur bcings pa la mthe bong nang du bcug ste /
translated: The vajra fist is the vajra fist with the thumb inserted inside.

original: sor mo thams cad kyis mnan pa ni rta mchog 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo thams cad kyis mnan pa ni rta mchog 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The line all fingers press down means that all fingers press down on the thumb. This is Hayagrīva together with his retinue.

original: las kyi phyag rgya thams cad ni lag pa gnyis kyis bcings te /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya thams cad ni lag pa gnyis kyis bcings te /
translated: All action seals are bound with both hands,

original: de rnams kyi rang gi snying po ci lta ba dang bcas par bcing ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi snying po ci lta ba dang bcas par bcing ngo //
translated: and they are bound along with their respective essence mantras.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bgegs rnams ni zhi ba'i don du dpal rdo rje las kyi phyag rgya shes pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bgegs rnams ni zhi ba'i don du dpal rdo rje las kyi phyag rgya shes pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the glorious vajra action seal knowledge for the purpose of pacifying the hindrances of desire and so forth,

original: rkang pa brkyang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “stretching out the foot,” and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas rkang pa brkyang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas rkang pa brkyang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba byas te /
translated: The vajra-mind practitioner performs the practice of “stretching out the foot,” and so on.🔽And also,

original: des kyang / g-yas dang g-yon pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: des kyang / g-yas dang g-yon pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: by the practice of the right and left,

original: zhes bya ba la rkang pa g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa gnyis kyis rim bzhin du skyes pa dang bud med kyi gzugs @115a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rkang pa g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa gnyis kyis rim bzhin du skyes pa dang bud med kyi gzugs @115a * //
translated: with the right and left feet, in order, the forms of men and women

original: mnan par gyur na /
analyzed: mnan par gyur na /
translated: are pressed down.

original: de ltar byas pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs pa thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs pa thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: By doing that, all worldly and transcendent and so forth are brought under control.

original: rnal 'byor bdag gi bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bdag gi bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The practitioner’s action is to be endowed with the yoga of Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar bya ba thams cad byas shing bgegs rnams nye bar zhi ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya legs par slob cing /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba thams cad byas shing bgegs rnams nye bar zhi ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya legs par slob cing /
translated: Thus, having performed all the actions and pacified the obstructors, the practitioner should train well in the mudras of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: rab tu dmigs pa'i don du dngos grub thams cad kyi phyag rgya shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu dmigs pa'i don du dngos grub thams cad kyi phyag rgya shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the mudras of all powers for the sake of clear realization,

original: khu tshur snying gar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khu tshur snying gar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The fist at the heart,” and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snying gar khu tshur kyi bdag nyid can gyi bud med kyi med kyi phyag rgya bcings na dngos po thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snying gar khu tshur kyi bdag nyid can gyi bud med kyi med kyi phyag rgya bcings na dngos po thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The practitioner of the yoga of Vajrasattva, having bound the mudra of a woman with the nature of a fist at the heart in the maṇḍala of the gaṇas, and so forth, will accomplish all things.

original: bud med kyi sbyor ba ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi sbyor ba ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs rnams kyi'o //
translated: “All the practices of women” refers to the hosts of goddesses such as Ratipradhāna.

original: g-yon pa 'gying ba'i tshul du bya //
analyzed: g-yon pa 'gying ba'i tshul du bya //
translated: The left hand is in the manner of a flirt,

original: zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa'i 'gying ba'i tshul gyis dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa'i 'gying ba'i tshul gyis dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The left hand is in the manner of a flirt, holding a bell.

original: lag g-yas rnag gi snying gar ni //
analyzed: lag g-yas rnag gi snying gar ni //
translated: The right hand is at the heart,

original: zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi phyag rgyas snying gar bstod pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi phyag rgyas snying gar bstod pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The right hand is in the manner of praise at the heart, holding a five-pointed vajra.🔽All women,

original: bud med thams cad ces bya ba ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i gtso bo sngon du 'gro ba bud med kyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: bud med thams cad ces bya ba ni bde ba'i mchog la sogs pa'i gtso bo sngon du 'gro ba bud med kyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: means the mudra of a woman who is the chief consort of Khecarī and so forth.

original: 'di ni rdo rje 'gying ba la rab tu sbyar bar bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje 'gying ba la rab tu sbyar bar bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the application of the vajra flirt.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor bas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor bas ni /
translated: For the yoga of Bhagavān Vairocana,

original: g-yon pa khu tshur gyis sna tshogs padma'i 'dzin pa g-yas pa ldang ba'i tshul gyis dbang phyug thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa khu tshur gyis sna tshogs padma'i 'dzin pa g-yas pa ldang ba'i tshul gyis dbang phyug thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: with the left hand in a fist holding a multicolored lotus, the right hand in the manner of rising, one should accomplish all lords.

original: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor pas g-yon gyis dril bu 'khrol la /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor pas g-yon gyis dril bu 'khrol la /
translated: For the yoga of Śrī Heruka, with the left hand ringing a bell,

original: g-yas pas rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba yongs su bskor zhing gsor bas sgyu ma thams cad 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba yongs su bskor zhing gsor bas sgyu ma thams cad 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: With the right hand, one should brandish and toss up a blazing five-pronged vajra, and all illusions will arise.

original: dpal padma gar gyi dbang phyag gi rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: dpal padma gar gyi dbang phyag gi rnal 'byor pas /
translated: The yogin of glorious Padmanartteśvara

original: lag pa g-yon pas sna tshogs padma bzung ste /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas sna tshogs padma bzung ste /
translated: should hold a multicolored lotus with the left hand,

original: lag pa de brla g-yon par gzhag la lag pa g-yas pa g-yas pa'i brla'i steng du gzhag ste /
analyzed: lag pa de brla g-yon par gzhag la lag pa g-yas pa g-yas pa'i brla'i steng du gzhag ste /
translated: place that hand on the left thigh, and place the right hand on the right thigh.

original: de'i mdzub me sems dpa'i la bzhugs pa'i tshul du khar bzhag na des mi dga' ba thams cad la bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mdzub me sems dpa'i la bzhugs pa'i tshul du khar bzhag na des mi dga' ba thams cad la bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one places the index finger in the mouth in the manner of abiding in the sattva, it will remove all displeasure.

original: rdo rje nyi ma'i rnal @115b 'byor pas ni g-yon gyis rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul du yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che 'dzin la /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'i rnal @115b 'byor pas ni g-yon gyis rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul du yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che 'dzin la /
translated: The yogin of Vajrasūrya should hold a wish-fulfilling jewel at the heart with the left hand in the manner of praise,

original: g-yas kyis ni bud med la sogs pa rin po che mchog 'dzin pas mchog sbyin pa ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yas kyis ni bud med la sogs pa rin po che mchog 'dzin pas mchog sbyin pa ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and with the right hand, one should give the supreme gift of holding a woman and so forth as the supreme jewel.

original: rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pas ni /
analyzed: rta mchog gi rnal 'byor pas ni /
translated: The yogin of Hayagrīva🔽should hold a lotus with the left hand at the heart,🔽and with the right hand, one should hold a noose in the manner of threatening.

original: g-yon gyis rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul du sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin /
analyzed: g-yon gyis rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul du sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin /
translated: Holding a vajra cross in the left hand at the heart in the manner of praise,

original: g-yas rdo rje 'gying bas dbang phyug dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yas rdo rje 'gying bas dbang phyug dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and with the right hand holding a vajra and dancing, one will attain the state of the supreme lord.

original: kun du sna tshogs kyi dam tshig gi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs kyi dam tshig gi rtog pa ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the Samaya of the All-Diverse.

original: rtog pa dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rtog pa dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the ninth chapter, on the Samaya.

original: // / da ni phyag rgya nyi shu rtsa bdun ji ltar bsgrub pa bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: // / da ni phyag rgya nyi shu rtsa bdun ji ltar bsgrub pa bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: Now, after the teaching on how to accomplish the twenty-seven seals,

original: kun du sna tshogs skal ba bzang po dpal dam tshig gi rtog pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs skal ba bzang po dpal dam tshig gi rtog pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the glorious Samaya of the All-Diverse Good Fortune,

original: de nas kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Then, the All-Diverse... and so on.

original: kun du sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs kyi phyag rgya shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of the All-Diverse Seal

original: phyag rgya nyi shu rtsa bdun shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya nyi shu rtsa bdun shes pa'o //
translated: is the knowledge of the twenty-seven seals.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: This refers to what was just explained.

original: kun du sna tshogs sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the union of the All-Diverse

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ltar sbyor ba'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ltar sbyor ba'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pa'o //
translated: means accomplishing the nature of the union with oneself.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir smin ma mig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir smin ma mig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to clearly teach just that, [the Bhagavān] declares, “eyebrows, eyes, and so forth,” and so on.

original: smin ma mig la sogs pa gsungs pa'i rim gyis /🔽cha lugs ji lta ba bzhin du gar byed pa ste /
analyzed: smin ma mig la sogs pa gsungs pa'i rim gyis / cha lugs ji lta ba bzhin du gar byed pa ste /
translated: In the sequence of the declaration of eyebrows, eyes, and so forth,🔽one should dance just as one’s costume is.

original: ji ltar mthun par gar byed pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun par gar byed pas so //
translated: One should dance in whatever way is suitable.

original: phyag rgya thams cad ces bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad ces bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: “All the mudrās” are the great mudrā.

original: yongs su 'grol zhes pa ni bcing ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'grol zhes pa ni bcing ba'o //
translated: “One should unbind” means to bind.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /🔽bdag nyid kyi lha'i bdag nyid ji lta ba la sogs pa'i smin ma dang / mig la sogs pas byas pa med na ni bdag nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te / bdag nyid kyi lha'i bdag nyid ji lta ba la sogs pa'i smin ma dang / mig la sogs pas byas pa med na ni bdag nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: phyag rgya chen po thams cad bcing bar bya'o zhes ba ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po thams cad bcing bar bya'o zhes ba ste /
translated: If one’s eyebrows, eyes, and so forth are not made just like one’s deity’s eyebrows, eyes, and so forth, then one should dance just as one is, and previously bind all the great mudrās.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rgyud kyi tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rgyud kyi tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should accomplish just as the collection of tantras explained previously.

original: da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya 'jig pa'i lan gyi phyag rgya bstan pa'i phyor /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya 'jig pa'i lan gyi phyag rgya bstan pa'i phyor /
translated: Now, in order to teach the reply gesture that destroys all mundane and supramundane seals,

original: dpal g-yon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽g-yon pa 'gying ba dang bcas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpal g-yon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / g-yon pa 'gying ba dang bcas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the glorious left, etc.🔽The left, with a sway,

original: g-yon pa 'gying ba dang bcas pas dril bu 'dzin la /
analyzed: g-yon pa 'gying ba dang bcas pas dril bu 'dzin la /
translated: means that with a sway of the left [hand] one holds a bell.

original: lag pa g-yas pas ni padma khu tshur @116a * //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas ni padma khu tshur @116a * //
translated: With the right hand one forms the lotus fist

original: bcangs nas dpral bar gzhag la /
analyzed: bcangs nas dpral bar gzhag la /
translated: and places it on the forehead.

original: khros pas gyen du blta ba'i tshul du byas pa ni //
analyzed: khros pas gyen du blta ba'i tshul du byas pa ni //
translated: With an angry, upward-glancing look,

original: dngos grub kyi mchog thams cad la sogs pa sgrub par byed do//
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mchog thams cad la sogs pa sgrub par byed do//
translated: one accomplishes all the supreme powers, etc.

original: kun du sna tshogs pa ni skal ba bzang po dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs pa ni skal ba bzang po dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: The various all is the glorious fortune of Vajrasattva’s imagination.

original: rtog pa bcu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rtog pa bcu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the tenth chapter of the tantra.

original: // / sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni //
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni //
translated: By the all buddhas, etc.,

original: rdo rje can 'dis che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje can 'dis che ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: the greatness of this vajra holder is taught.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po yon tan mang ldan mkhas pa'i spyod yul ba //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po yon tan mang ldan mkhas pa'i spyod yul ba //
translated: The king of tantras, endowed with many qualities, the domain of the wise,

original: don rgyas don ldan tshogs ni shin tu 'brel sbas pa'i //
analyzed: don rgyas don ldan tshogs ni shin tu 'brel sbas pa'i //
translated: Vast in meaning, meaningful, with a hidden connection,

original: 'dir ni bdag gis lo 'dab rtse tsam blangs nas rnam phye yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag gis lo 'dab rtse tsam blangs nas rnam phye yi //
translated: Here I have taken just the tip of the leaves and analyzed them,

original: mchog tu mkhas pa'i rjes 'brang dam pa rnams ni tshad ma yin //
analyzed: mchog tu mkhas pa'i rjes 'brang dam pa rnams ni tshad ma yin //
translated: The supreme wise followers are the authority.

original: dka' 'brel 'di ni sbyar ba yis //
analyzed: dka' 'brel 'di ni sbyar ba yis //
translated: By this connection with difficulty,🔽Whatever virtue I have,

original: bdag gi dge ba gang yin des //🔽rab zhi bshes gnyen bcas pa yi //
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba gang yin des // rab zhi bshes gnyen bcas pa yi //
translated: By that,🔽May the world become vajra holders, along with the peaceful spiritual friends.

original: 'jig rten rdo rje 'dzin par shog / sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i dka' 'grel //
analyzed: 'jig rten rdo rje 'dzin par shog / sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i dka' 'grel //
translated: The commentary on the difficult points of the union with all buddhas

original: slob dpon rab tu zhi ba'i bshes gnyen kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon rab tu zhi ba'i bshes gnyen kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po aa ts'arya shraddha ka ra warma dang / dharm'a shr'i bha dra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po aa ts'arya shraddha ka ra warma dang / dharm'a shr'i bha dra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Acarya Sradhakaravarman and Dharma Shri Bhadra, and the great translator-editor, the monk Rinchen Zangpo, translated and edited this.
